reviews.text: Oh Lord, I can't believe this was once Bill's Kitchen & Teriyaki, the deadest place you could ever enter with the most mediocre Japanese food this side of Tokyo Express. I still recall their Pork Chop Ramen which was a bowl of packaged-tasting noodles with a pair of burnt pork chops on a separate plate. Seriously. But now, it's wall-to-wall hipsters with a slick urban crunch bordertown vibe as Garaje tries to make up its mind what it is. It's definitely dinerish with a Mexican roadside twist that makes it the perfect Latino complement to the Asian-twanged HRD Coffee Shop a few doors down. It was Jamie W. who suggested who come here, so I wanted to take advantage of his rare venture into trying something new.
Amazing and delicious.. Try the special fries and the tacos.. Love it will come again and again!!!

Came here for the Cali Zapata and I ended up ordering the Rolls Royce (The Cali Zapata w/ shrimp added). I think next time I would probably stick with the Cali on its own, but both were pretty good....I just wasn't feeling the shrimp for some reason. Adding some refried beans would really take it to the next level in my opinion, but that's because I grew up eating California burritos that way) Make sure you request their in-house hot sauce (although very mild), unless you're really into the bottled stuff. Awesome beer selection. Places seems like it would be perfect for large groups.

A co-worker took me there for lunch one day and I had to go back. Fortunately, I was not disappointed. Hands down the best tacos I've ever eaten, on multiple visits now. Add it to a wide variety of draft beers, tables with built-in smartphone charges, and great service. Can't think of a better way to multi-task than to power up my phone's battery while enjoying a beer on tap. A sure bet for a night out in SOMA.
This place was freaking awesome.  Seriously.

Well price, very good tacos and poblanos. Everything here is fantastic and savory. It hits the spot when your tipsy or way past that. I love spicy and they have the spicy sauce that had the wooden top on it. I grew in San Diego living off of good cheap Mexican food, this really is one of the best Mexican foods in sf

Garaje effortlessly beats other Mex joints as its ambience for the price-range is hard-to-find in prime San Francisco. Its orangish exteriors made me think twice if it was at the right place or not because it looks a little tucked away in a series of confusing small businesses. Obscurity!

Seriously good eats.  You might have to wait a little longer, they are chatty at the register, but oh man, when you get your order.  Excellent fish tacos, but I go for the prawn one everytime.  Awesome decor!  Cool vibe, walking distance from Howard, mission, etc.  will give 5 stars if cashiers realize not the best time to hold a long conversation with every customer when there is a huge line.  But I digress...

Service: lovely! The staff here is super nice and welcoming. Every time I am there they offer me something, a sampling of their newest local brews. Or this weeks locally made desert. They always have a smile Amon and are full of energy!

I was very happy they were able to make me a vegan zapato.  Basically, they made the vegetarian without cheese but they added corn.  My only complaint is that they used so much corn that there was more corn than there was anything else (i.e. more corn than beans), so that was a little odd.  To their credit, the corn was fresh (not canned)  If I go back, I'll just ask for the veggie zapato without cheese.
You want good cheap food. Head to garaje !
Garaje's red facade opens up to a 2 level, double-skylit galley. It seems to get busy here and the line was rather long.

I've probably been here 10+ times at this point. It is a fun place with a lot of atmosphere for a casual lunch or dinner. It's kind of like being in a cool garage with street signs and automotive motifs everywhere. It's lively and often full even later into the night.
Garaje is an amazing "hole in the wall" restaurant in SoMa.  The outside looks relatively run-down, but the inside is actually quite a nice restaurant/bar.  Don't let the exterior fool you.
Great food, great place, cheap. I'm really impressed how good this place is.

My first trip to San Francisco,I ate my first meal at this restaurant. Wow The food was fresh delicious and reasonably priced. I loved the Indiana license plates as the decor.I wish I was a local to eat there everyday.Keep up the work and personable hospitality.

The first time I had Garaje, my friend and I were trying to hit up HRD only to find that it was closed for the day. We found this place on Yelp and passed the storefront twice because the sign was somewhat non-obvious. I didn't really know what to expect but I ordered a Zapato and sat down with my ticket. A few short minutes passed and a panini-pressed burrito arrived at my table. It looked humble enough, but when I took my first bite, my mouth exploded with rich, creamy, chewy, crunchy, and savory sensation. Yum. The Zapato is created when French Fries, beans, cheese, guacamole, and meat are married within a compressed and crispy tortilla. It was what I could only call pure happiness compressed into a dense and efficient package.

Get the California Steak Zapato. I've been here twice and ordered this both times. It's awesome. A heart-attack in a tortilla, probably, but awesome. Zapato means "shoe" in Spanish, but this not-quite-burrito tastes nothing like a shoe. It's a grilled tortilla with steak, guacamole, and French fries inside. Did I just describe your three favorite things in one sentence? Ever imagined them combined? Go to Garaje and try it for yourself.
I stopped in to this "Garage" with some friends while visiting SF. The atmosphere is oily and deep fried meets a grimy pub.. fun!
This place is awesome! Must stop at this place before a Giants game. Get the tacos or zapattos and huge selection of beer.
The beer battered tilapia taco's are bangin!

One of my friends sang the praises of Garaje, so we made plans to meet up one day for lunch during the work week. There was a pretty long line at the counter, but we were able to snag a table pretty easily after ordering.

I made an out-of-the-way effort to eat here, but wouldn't recommend it unless you are jn the area. Had the fish &chips zapato, which was unique sounding, but it was just a sandwiched pressed burrito with fish and French fries, and some guacamole. Good was decent enough, but the service that day, not busy, took 20 min to get my order. To me, that was a bit too long for something that was supposed to be fast and simple.

We came on a Thursday night and immediately found open tables around 6pm. No line either! When we left, there was a long line and people were waiting for us to leave our table. So I recommend getting there early! There is also a lot of free parking on the side streets nearby.

This place is pretty legit. Ordered the crab sanwich and it was smackin. The batter was crispy. The bread was toasted good. The chipotle mayo just made everything better. The prices ain't bad either but your gonna be spending about $10 here since everything is mostly 8 and above unless your just getting a taco. Otherwise I highly recommend their local menu items as well as their burgers. Zapatos were alright. Basically expected the flavor but still good. Only problem with this place is that its really hard to find parking. But I say its worth the struggle.
Food was incredible and unique.
Love the place. Great tasty food and reasonable price. The only problem is that you might have a hard time finding seats.
Hands down my favorite taco place in the city!
The grilled fish tacos are great! Yummy guacamole! It can get quite busy during lunch, but the line moves pretty fast!
Happy spot = our go to spot in SoMa. Good food & good burgers & good beer. I wish they were open on Sundays - as this part if the city closes on Sunday evenings.
Wildly overrated. The food was OK but nothing special. It also made me horribly sick. Wanted to like this place but would have been better off going to Chipotle. Just not 4.5 star worthy.

After reviews by my trusted fellow Yelpers I knew I had to try Garaje.  The problem?  I am not usually in the area during its hours of operations.  Yes, I am in this neighborhood just about every weekend, but usually during the day when Garaje is closed.  ARGH!  It didn't help that everyone was telling me how great the food is here.

Why get french fries on the side when you can have them INside your burrito? (Or zapato as the case is at Garaje). Come to think of it, french fries aren't all that Mexican at all but regardless, the combination works and is so freakin' delicious. I'm dreaming about it all the way down here in Miami.

This place is awesome but requires some serious patience.  Wait time for food is often 20 minutes and wait time to even order at the counter can take another 10 minutes.  I've actually walked out of here 4 times because the line was too long and I knew it would be over 30 minutes just to get a burger.  It takes a long time to get food here.  However, if you're a big beer and sports fan then this place is cool to hang out at because they have plenty of both.   It's a place to relax and hang out with friends or coworkers after a long day or a good place to catch a game.
Sat upstairs and got the zapato! Order came far quicker and generally all together this time. The food was very filling and the flavor was unusual :))

For first timers I'd suggest dinner, 'cause the lunch lines are an immediate turn off, unless of course you are trying to chat up a new client or love interest. Expect  20 min wait time and more after  12:15. This is a tech lunch haven, so if you must , get there  at 11:30 for the least wait. Once you do get to the order desk, be sure you have cash on the barrel head or you are  SOL. The vibe is super casual garage theme with a license plate collection meets Rock poster collection. Give it an 8.5 on the coolio meter.They even thought enough about the interior to put  sound  baffles in the low ceiling entrance  area. There is also an upstairs  balcony.
Dang! This place gets packed at lunchtime, but it's well worth the wait.
Curious to know where all the SoMa engineers go for lunch? It appears to be Garaje!
A "no crap on tap" sign is posted at the front and boy do they mean it. Great beer selection. I went with a delicious stout last night.
The short: mediocre food

This place is amazing for lunch!  The brie and turkey sandwich is so delicious and all of their salads are so tasty!  The half sandwich/salad combo is such a deal!  SO much food!  Call ahead and order because it does get very busy at lunch.  And for good reason!

I am a sandwich critic because my mom made me the best sanwhiches growing up and i consequently make some pretty good sanwhiches myself. This place has better sanwhiches than any other place I have ever had. I got the egg salad sandwich on a baguette and the portobello sandwich and split the two with my sister. If the silence was broken at completely silent table (all completely engorged in our meals) it was a moan let out by one of us. Amazing, that is all.

This is one of my favorite spots for a delicious sandwich and salad. Every time I visit Cafe Du Soleil I have a 5-star experience. The owner is very kind, helpful, and makes sure that everything comes out perfectly. He is a master of his profession and his passion for food definitely shows. The restaurant is quaint and clean. If you go before 4:30, you can get the lunch combo and it's totally worth it.

Today's persimmon chicken salad - it was a visual and a gourmet treat rolled up in one!  The sweetness of persimmon against chickory greens and chicken - so very delicious!!  Michael and his staff always go the extra mile to please their customers.   They are the very best!
Three words....Order The Sandwiches.
Fantastic! Incredible salads and sandwiches. I had the Maison salad with chicken (which is hot rotisserie chicken) and a Cafe au Lait with almond milk.

I had lunch here during a conference at Moscone. It was magnifique! The salad with Scottish salmon was fresh with delicious dressing. The turkey, Brie & peach sandwich was fantastic. My friend had the Niciose salad, lobster bisque and loved them. We highly recommend it! Service was friendly & excellent too!
The best lunch I have had in years! We ordered the nicoise salad, the turkey/brie/peach sandwich and the lobster bisque. Everything was amazing!

Amazing!!  The $13 lunch combo with half sandwich and half Nicoise salad was so delicious I wanted to lick the plate. The salad ingredients were fresh and bright, and the baguette for the sandwich had so much depth I wanted to cry.

Nicoise salad is awesome at this cafe! I eat salads everyday and without hesitation I give this place two thumbs up. The tuna, eggs, lettuce, beans, potatoes, red peppers, capers, olives are mixed to perfection. As often as I visit this place, the salad is always fresh and tasty. I will continue to visit this place as long as they don't change the chef. I have a sensitive palate and  will know when another person prepares this salad. So if you are in the neighborhhod--try this cafe--it's worth every cent. Last but not least, their mocha cafe is excelent--so much so that I stopped going to Starbucks.  Michael has great customer skills and knows how to stir mocha drinks to perfection. His staff reflects his charisma. Hence the tips that we, as customers, leave for the tasty food and outstanding service.
The BEST SOMA lunch spot I know of - a little gem, just south of Moscone. My girlfriends from the office and I head here once a week for real food; perfectly prepared and always delicious.

What a wonderful cafe in San Francisco! I love the half salad and sandwich combos, everything I have tried is delicious and the owner Michael is very welcoming and friendly. There usually is a line during lunch because it's so good. Definitely recommend this place to anyone who is in SF.

WOW. The Shrimp bay sandwich is out of this world!!! I love the creamy mayo with the fresh dill and cucumber and avocado. I was blown away by the sandwich and I can't wait to come back an try more things!!
Been here a few times and no matter what I order (usually a salad or a sandwich) the food tastes great every time!
The food is fresh but the taste is nothing special.

My first time here but promise it won't be my last! The salad and sandwich combo is plenty of food for not-too-bad price, considering the quality. Had a smoked-salmon and asparagus salad w/ a half cheddar apple pastrami sandwich and they both were delish!

Small shop with really good food. The owner is really friendly and helpful. Today there is a big event, so the shop was really busy. Despite this, the owner took the  time to chat with me and joke around. If you get a "half" salad and "half" sandwich, I promise you'll be full.
Cafe Du Soleil filled that void of good sandwich around my work. Simply the best cafe for sandwich and salad in the SOMA neighborhood.

Super cute place. At first seemed rather expensive, but the combo deal half salad, half sandwich for $13 is really nice. We actually thought they messed up our orders because it looked like too much food for a French cafe haha.

I came by with a craving for some fresh veggies and was not disappointed. I don't usually take the time to make a Salad Nicoise at home and so was excited to see it on their menu. The greens and vegetables were very fresh and tasty, and the salad was well dressed. Overall this is a classic Salad Nicoise with potatoes, tuna, green beans, and egg. Just how I like it! And the small portion size was enough to fill me. I noticed that the cashier and who I assume is the owner, has a bit of a brisk manner of dealing with people; I think he is well meaning and this is just his European personality. I was very happy with the experience and would come back for a salad if I were in the area.
Delicious food! And the owner is an absolute gem. So humble, kind, friendly, and generous. Can't wait to come back again and again :)
Love this place! The smoked salmon salad (I forgot the exact name of it) is TO DIE for! I definitely will be coming back the next time I'm in SF!

I would love to keep Cafe du Soleil my secret lunch spot, but I just can't do that to the best little lunch spot in all of the city, it is so AWESOME!  Sometimes the wait is long and line is out the door, but there is good reason.  The wait and line is nothing like LA or NY, so quit crying about the wait because the food is that good.  The lunch combos, salad/sandwich or salad/soup are the best for trying a couple of things.  It's all good, try not to eat the same thing twice until you have tried everything there at least once.  I have too many favorites to list.  Thank you!
Some of the best food in San Francisco. Order ahead because Michael takes his time making everybody's order a masterpiece. This is quality and deliciousness.
Stopped by here for a late lunch with my boyfriend after finding this place on Yelp and it did not disappoint! Absolutely delicious.

Ordered a turkey and avocado sandwich and it came without avocado, leaving it as two pieces of bread, turkey, spread and a massive amount of lettuce. So much lettuce that the sandwich couldn't reasonably hold it all. It was also on the small side and I ended up needing a second lunch a few hours later.
This place is DELISH.
I passed by several time in front of this inviting small place and today I have my first lunch there with a friend.

One of my favorite lunch spots in the soma! The owner and his staff are very hard working and always are really nice. I love the Niçoise salad, peach-turkey sandwich and the st. Albray+mushroom sandwich.  I recommend the"la combo" because you get a sufficient amount of salad and half of a sandwich. I usually just eat the salad during lunch and the sandwich late afternoon.
BY FAR the BEST lunch spot in the city.

I came in here for the first time today and ordered the small caprese sandwich.  For the price ($6.50) it was a decent size but was on the lighter side for a lunch.  However, it left me feeling satisfied enough.  If you're hungry, I'd order the large.  Quality and flavor wise there was nothing really to complain about.  The bread was top notch and the ingredients were fresh.  I subtracted one star because I was asked if I wanted it hot and I said cold, yet I received it hot.  Also, I would like more info about where the bread and meat come from.
Just tried this place for lunch and was super impressed for a teensy little cafe!

Great salads in terms of taste and quantity. Good convenient location to work. -1 star for the slow service on the orders. I had to wait 20 minutes for my salad. The owner who is there needs to start pushing orders out quicker.. If not, he might start losing customers for the slow service. No one should have to wait 20 min for a Caesar salad ..
The coffee drinks are good.  The ham gruyere sandwich is okay but not fantastic.  The outdoor seating is pleasant, and the location is convenient.
Stumbled upon this cafe on my recent trip to SF. Pleasant, little lunch spot a bit misplaced in SoMa.

I'm in LOVE! Okay, so the line is super long, even at ~2PM on a weekday, but the service is really friendly. This restaurant received rave reviews from my coworkers, and I'm not much of a sandwich person, anyway. I ordered the half sandwich and half salad. I asked which combos were on the "approved list", and they said ANY combo I wished. Thinking about the long line ahead of us, I made a quick decision and selected the PROSCUITTO DI PARMA which is Shaved Parmigiano-Reggiano, French Baguette and the CHICKEN, AVOCADO & MANGO which is the Organic mixed baby greens, Roasted chicken, avocado, Mango, Persian lime & ginger vinaigrette. The sandwich looks unassuming, but is super delicious. I took a few bites, but I needed to save it to share with my kids after work. The salad was soooo amazing with the huge slices of mangoes and fresh berries, and REAL chicken that was succulent and cooked perfectly for a salad.
I love this awesome lil French café!
LOVE this cute little French cafe because of the following reasons:

I literally just made a Yelp account about a minute ago so I could review this place. First things first, this place is really small and adorable, I didn't worry too much about the seating because I was taking it back to the office to eat but just keep that in mind.
Service is slow but I guess that's to be expected.

Bad-ass sister restaurant of "San Tung Restaurant" in Sunset, probably the best American Korean Chinese food (you may say WTF, but yes) you can have in the city. Their fried chicken wings is probably the most peppery stuff I had in my life, unforgettable. Other dishes are OK, some with huge portions (and lot of rice), like the rice with ribs, not sure how one can finish that.
If I had a choice whether to dine at San Tung or SO, 99 times out of 100, I'd choose SO over San Tung.  Here's why:

I met up a friend here for lunch and was excited to try this spot given the amazing yelp reviews and how crowded it was when we arrived.  We had the "Mao Pao noodles" and "Whatever" dish.  I thought it was strange that the waiter brought us soup bowls when we didn't order soup; when the food arrived I realized that the sauce noodles we ordered were basically in a thick soup form which I found strange.  I typically love spicy food but both dishes were spicy in a bad way.  There was just something off about all the seasoning in the dishes.  At the end when we declined to take our leftovers the waiter seemed offended (awkward).
People who don't like this place must hate their lives. I've never been disappointed with a meal here.

I love them and their badass attitude!  The mushrooms are so bleeping good!  I think that they are suffering from being too popular.  people that have to wait get grumpy.  Expect a wait, and enjoy the delicious food!!!!

Ordered take-out from here on a Friday night -- quick and great customer service. I would give it 3.5 stars because the food was yummy, but average quality. We ordered the black bean noodles, chicken wings and mapo tofu over noodles (basically the dishes that everyone raves about). Noodles were super chewy and the chicken wings were delicious. Make sure to eat them while they're hot!
My boyfriend lives a few blocks away, and we come here often.

I have found a place where I can get the sapor of immensely tasty fried chicken, noodles, and dishes made with beef. Yes I am talking about SO; a perfect stead to chill out and have some remarkable food. I also enjoyed different shakes and beer. There is lot more in the beverages, as the way you like to pick. I thoroughly enjoyed the tasty, captivating, and spicy food out there. Everyone can enjoy this affordable treat. Chipotle fried rice and chicken wings are the specialty of this place, and I enjoyed every bit of it to the fullest.
Great food but the wings are some of the best I've ever had! I live 14 hrs away and I will go back anytime I'm in San Fran

Update: I have been back for lunch a couple times now and have tried several things. All of them amazing. The diced chicken, cherry chicken, and green beans are killer! I don't even live in the city and I crave So all the time!
The food simply isn't good.  It was average.  Had the Mao Pao sauce noodles with beef, and the spiciness was attempting to make up for the apparent lack in flavor.
What I had assumed was just your run of the mill asian fusion SF eatry, SO turned out to be the exact opposite.

I've started eating at the old San Tung on the other side of 19th ave since middle school, some 20 years or so ago.  I'm getting old, but the food is still as great as ever!  Haven't been back because of the lines at the new place, but SO happy this location is here and I can actually walk in and get seated and eat!  And good beer too. Great noodles, wings are even better than the original because of the spices!  I love it!  Who cares about msg and gluten free?  If you do, then go somewhere else, more for me!! Muahahahhaha.
Tasty food all around.  The wings are a definite must order starter, then so many different options.  Really enjoyed the food here.

My boyfriend and I paid SO a visit on Friday night after our Costco run. I had been craving fried chicken for weeks and had yet to find a place to satisfy my craving. After some yelp reviews, I decided that SO would be the place that I though could best satisfy my cravings. My boyfriend was a total sweetheart and came along for the ride. Parking was a bit of a struggle (after some serious parking maneuvering, I managed to find a spot right in front of the restaurant) and even though we got there kind of late, there were 4 parties of 2 in front of us so we had to wait for a bit. Of course we had to order the fried chicken, we also ordered the string beans, the potstickers, coroque, and the black bean sauce noodles.
Highlights

I don't know...I'm just not convinced by this place. I had such high hopes for the black bean sauce! My friend had the pork noodles and I had the renowned black bean noodles, but neither had a lot of flavor.
Love, love, love their fried wings. Gotta try! Everything else is ok, but their wings are to crave for.

Food: 2 stars overall. The green beans had OK flavor (maybe it was MSG?) but overcooked and too oily; the chicken wings were good; and the mao pao was seriously lacking - noodles were soggy and the spiciness didn't make up for the off flavor.

OMG I love this place.  Been here twice and I am obsessed with their chicken wings and chipotle fried rice!!!! Chicken wings are JUST as good as san tung!! Chipotle fried rice def has MSG!!! Lol.  Actually I don't know but I know it's addicting.  YUM!!!
I wish I could have 0 stars. Such rude waiter. That guy at the cashier is a dhead. Go there bcz of the reviews and experience it.
Wings again!

My favorite chicken wing place in San Fran.  The SO noodles are amazing and spicy.  Basically I've never had a bad meal here.  I totally support these guys cause they serve amazing food!  Stupid customers should not show up so I don't have to wait in line (cause there is usually a very long line--people know a good thing when they taste it and yes that includes MSG).

This review is for my visit to SO on 09/24/2014. I actually bookmarked this place to try when they had first opened, but completely forgot about them until I read an article about how the chef walked out after back to back complaints and whatnot. The article included photos of handwritten signs posted stating that the restaurant uses MSG, does not believe in organic food, and does not, um, care about gluten free. Not being a stranger to Chinese food, I did not mind that there was MSG in my non-organic and gluten-laden food.

James Chu's pro-MSG marketing campaign worked. Here I was, sitting in his small restaurant awaiting the infamous Chicken Wings and Chipotle Sausage Fried Rice. And I will say they were amazing. My favorite was actually the fried rice. Coming out of the kitchen piping hot, the rice was still moist and not overly dry, and the overall dish was well seasoned and balanced with shredded cabbage and mushrooms. The Chipotle sausage was delicious and thinly cut. I ordered the fried rice without jalapeños so it wasn't spicy, which paired really well with the chicken wings since they already have a bit of a spicy kick to them.

Tried the infamous chicken wings and they are just as good as the stories! Yes, it is a bit spicy (mostly from black pepper), but I could not stop eating them! They were the crispiest wings I have ever had.

To the owner, Please don't close the restaurant after reading my post. Hehe. I don't mind MSG, it's umami. The wings, fried rice, dumplings were all so GOOD!. I just had a bad experience with the waitress, the short Asian, mid 30's?, a nickle, wearing yoga pants with granny panty inside..the lines gave it away.

A good deal for great food! On the surface the prices may not seem that special but the size of the portions more than makes up for it. Be sure to try the wings, but hope you like white pepper - seems to be one of their favourite ingredients! Cheapish beer and good spice levels make for a great meal. Come early as it fills up fast
Had the diced chicken wings, regular chicken wings, string beans, and garlic pork noodle.

I've always thought San Tung was way overrated, good to be sure, but not worth the hype.  This place is comparable.  In a vacuum, I'd rank both places as 3/4-star tweeners.  But given that the payoff in my opinion doesn't equal the hype, I'd make it 3 stars.  But in SO's case, HUGE props for saying F.U. to all the picky eaters.  Guess what people, sometimes a hair falls unnoticed off the head of the food preparer, whether you're at home or in a restaurant.  And sometimes a tiny bug survives the lettuce-washing process.  And here's a big shocker: Walk in to the kitchen of the nicest 5-star restaurant in the City at 3 a.m. and turn the lights on suddenly.  Odds are high you will see a roach scurry off.  That's just how it is.  So push that hair or bug aside, eat the rest of your food, and don't whine.  And if you don't want the food the way the chef intends to make it for you, stay home and cook for yourself.  P.S. Extra MSG and gluten on mine, please.
This review is not based on the food.
Had to check this place out after the owner blew a gasket and called out all his customers for wanting healthier, non-MSG food (See picture section).  Hilarious.

The food here is fantastic. It's an offshoot of San Tung (well that's what everyone tells me), and you can see it in their wings - they have the same texture as San Tung's but are BETTER because they have a spicy kick. I love that.
Time: 12:31pm/78°F intermittent cloud

I support this business even more after all the bad publicity it has gotten regarding the owner's attitude towards some of his demanding customers. I worked for a restaurant where some customers were down right rude, racist and disrespectful to the staff and we felt helpless because the manager and owner cared about making money only. At the end of the day, we all work for our dignity and some customers feel that they are (over) entitled. mr chu...  Great job and you will have my business!!! Keep kicking those assholes out
Chicken wings were great. Best beef and fried rice in San Fransisco. Highly recommended. Prices are reasonable. Location is very convinient.
****CUSTOMER SINCE JUDAH /IRVING****
I ate at this place weekly for over a year. Delicious, great service. No bullshit.

Damn I love this place.  Depending on what I am eating I may need a gallon of water as a side dish, but you know what you are getting.  Obviously the wings are a must have, but so are the green beans, most of the noodle dishes and the Dirty Dastard (with the egg especially).

Deli board makes great food.  The sandwiches are delightful, they taste fresh, the bread is soft, and the flavor is great.  The salads have fresh ingredients, and are a great portion.  The downside? A sandwich or salad will cost you $16.00 and 30 minutes of your time, just to get the food.

I had to give 2 stars only because of the price. The sandwich itself was pretty good. Soft bread, good tasting meat, and fresh veggies. However $20 for a sandwich and cup of soup is pretty ridiculous. I do not think I will return to this place as I can get great deli sandwiches for half the price at many other places in the city, and these are nothing to write home about.

This place makes my stomach & heart happy. I live on the Peninsula but work in the city & I crave their sandwiches when I'm back home. I love their creative menu, funky sandwich names, & their sandwiches. The $$$ is exactly that..money, money, money in my tummy, tummy, tummy. It's filled with meat, cheesy goodness, and flavor. I could eat it 5 times a day. And don't forget the Skully! Turkey, kosher salami, cheese, and all the fixings..And now I'm hungry.

Came here because of the great reviews. Both of the two sandwiches were incredibly small and the were just so-so at best. I should not be able to eat a $14 sandwich in 9 bites. The reason I am giving them 2 stars is because I paid $32 for two sandwiches.  I feel like an idiot for paying that much for two sandwiches.  I would have had the same experience going to subway, grinding the meat up, microwaving it, putting the meat back on, and spending $10 on two sandwiches. This place is VERY VERY over rated.
This has to be the best sandwich I have ever had.  Pricing is right in line for quality food in San Francisco.
The most under rated and under-talked about sandwich place in SF. So much better than Ike's and Wise Sons. The guy running this joint also has great place, "The Rye Project".

Been meaning to try his place for a long time now. Since it's open only during the day i never get to it. Was in the area for a meeting so i hit it up before heading there. The Hermine is a loaded sandwich. Brisket, corned beef, muenster, pastrami, sauce, good bread. Good pickle on the side and a Doc Browns. With tip that got to be basically $20 for lunch. Now if the sandwich were twice e size id probably be more comfortable with the price. Its no less tasty just a tad on the expensive side. Still worth trying though if youve never been
Sure, the sandwiches might be a bit on the expensive side, but that'll help me not eat here every day and endanger the tensile strength of  my belt.

What's better than overstuffed sandwiches on a Saturday afternoon?  Our SF hosts have lunch here regularly on Saturdays just to enjoy the special BK sandwich = sausage, bacon eggs and cheese.  Turned out to be my favorite meal in SF.  Husband had the Zeke and also raved.  Fun and friendly staff and a line out the door for the whole time we were there.
My coworker was going to get a sandwich from here and asked if I wanted to tag along.  How can I say no to a sandwich? (Cue in appropriate Joey Tribbiani GIF).
Hot roast beef and munster cheese todsy, exceptionally good!!!  Try any of Adam's soups and / or salads if you are not up for a sandwich.
This place is amazing.  I would give it 6 stars.  The pastrami and brisket feeds my dreams.  Great staff too.
Why, cruel universe, do you close deli board at 4?  So good!  I wish I could get a sammy here after 6 when I get off, but alas.  Pickles!!!
been eating these sammiches since they had the little window shop on howard and STILL can't find a better deli.
The food gets a solid 5 stars no questions asked. Some of the best pastrami I have ever had in my life.

So, here is the deal.  This place is just about the stupidest place that I have ever had a sandwich in my life.  There is absolutely no reason to pay the ridicules cost for a sandwich that this place charges and the energy could not be in more bland and boring...  I grew up in San Francisco and there was a time where the expectation of a good sandwich shop was more like Lucca or Molinari or Roxie's or but NOT Subways!  Go to Tony Baloney's down the street if you want a killer sandwich at a fair price with interesting decor.

I believe that they are the best sandwich spot for any meat lover. Their price tells you about the quality of the meat that goes into that sandwich. The moment I digest that sandwich I feel like going back for more. They are known for the pastrami and my favorite is the Corned beef. I also like the Tuna on Dutch Crunch. I like the quality of the clover sprouts, pickles and all other fixxings that go into my sammich. I highly recommend this place to anyone that likes a hot meat loaded sandwich.
It's way overpriced, but I don't care because it's just that good... All about that Cohen.

Sandwich was really good! Staff was friendly and welcoming. My only complaint was it's too expensive I would say instead of $14 it should be no more than $11. If the price was adjusted I would be at least a weekly regular.

Ordered the Chloe w Dutch crunch instead of a French roll and added Pepperchini mix. The sandwich is REALLY good, woulda been perfect with a little more sauce... I added some stadium mustard to it. It comes with pickles on the side, yum. I did order a bag of chips and water bottle with it, and it came to like $19 ... Definitely WAY more money than I like to spend on lunch, but I'm on jury duty and they had great reviews so I had to check it out. It is a great spot though! They had a line the whole hour I've been here.

So goooood!  Sandwiches are substantial. During the day I can't eat too much bc I will surely fall asleep.  Back in high school I had band class after lunch and I swear, I fell asleep sometimes. Anyways, in order to avoid food induced narcolepsy, I only ate half of my sandwich. It pained me to give the other half away to a friend but I needed to stay awake.  I had the Ron which was delicious. It had a great balance of flavors - nothing that was too overpowering. It was roast beef, cheddar, slaw, jalapeños, and avocado on a garlic French roll. Sandwiches are served hot!  Also, they give you a giant pickle on the side that tasted like Clausen pickles - my favorite since they are crunchy and have a strong salty, vinegary, dill flavor.  Will be back!
I'm giving this place 2 stars because the price is outrageous.

Super Hight Quality Meat.  Their sauces are awesome too, so don't forget to try those while you are there.  Also, if there is a sandwich you really like remember the name, they rotate menu but they can make it again usually.
Like most negative reviews on Yelp some ot the ones here are just so stupid.
Was excited to see what all the hype was about, and while the food itself is good, the service and staff leave much to be desired.

Warm, meaty, flavorful sandwiches.  Good variety and creative combinations of ingredients.  They are a bit on the pricey side and tend to be a bit of gut-bomb, but I love gut-bombs.  If you dig Reubens, grab the Ruby Claire.
The VHAT. Yes.
Do yourself a favor and go here!!  Ahhhhh-Mazing sandwiches!!!  We tried The Zeke and The Mezman!  Both Oh. So. Good.

This place is very good for the food and for the people that work here are very friendly. I live across the street from deli board don't get me wrong the first time I tried I was surprised with the prices, $9 a sandwich whow, hey this is the city so prices are a bit higher. The sandwich was very good, tasty, meaty not dry at all. Just noticed that the price went up again $9, $11 and now $15 for a sandwich. I like this place but for a local resident with a family, I sure have to think twice about eating here, beside the majority of the people eating their look like younger techie hipsters with no kids that have no problem in paying that much for a sandwich. So I'm pretty sure they will be good with out my support of ever buying a sandwich their again so I will enjoy this cause it's the last I'll have. $$$$$

Seems like this is where hipsters go to grab some good pastrami. It's a cute little place that offers a variety of hot sandwiches and fresh salads. I had the pastrami sandwich and I have to say, I think I prefer thick cut pastrami better, so the sandwich was okay. The meat was good but too thin for my liking. The bread tasted similar to potbelly sandwich bread so a bit on the chewier side. I really liked the bubbies salad which was egg salad, tuna salad, and chicken salad on a bed of field greens. You could tell they made the salads from scratch so I felt really good after eating the whole thing.

One of our favorite restaurants in the city. We make the trip, which is very out of our way, at least once a week. Why? Best sandwiches in the city. Hands down. Also, great appetizers (if they happen to have one - jewshi, newshi, platter, whatever - GET IT), soups, and salads. And hot sauces. Super tasty housemade hot sauces in rotating flavors. But really cannot overstate how PHENOMENAL the sandwiches are. Don't forget to check the specials board or you might miss out on the BK breakfast sandwich, the meaty gyro, the messy Italian beef, the cheesesteak I myself keep missing, or something else exciting.

If you love sandwiches, you'll LOVE deli board. I got their Boca and wasn't disappointed. Warm and toasted, lots of sauce, melted cheese...portions aren't ginormous like little luccas but it's still a pretty heavy sandwich. I ate half for lunch and the other half for dinner; still good later :)
Prices have climbed significantly in the past year and the sandwiches have gotten significantly smaller.
OVERRATED.
Let me first be very clear. This is not a quick and cheap sandwich joint a la (the spectacularly good) Ted's. This is a high-end sandwicherie.

I got the Chloe and it arrived wrapped as a stolid grenade that when split open, rushed forth like an oven door in a steamy burst of soft French bread, juicy stacks of meat (turkey, Romanian pastrami, and salami), coleslaw and spicy cherry peppers.

the first couple times i came here, i thought the sandwiches were so good.  after a few more times, the sandwiches started to all taste the same.  especially if you order from the first column where the meat is pastrami, corned beef etc.

One of the best restaurants in San Francisco. Amazing sandwiches, fantastic meat, special "Newish" appetizers on occasion. Friendly staff, speedy service, and a spacious ambiance. House-made hot sauce, "Stadium" mustard. You must try it!

This really is as good as it gets. Albeit this is a substantial walk from my office (15-20 minutes), its worth every second. If I'm ever craving a sandwich, or a salad, Deli Board never fails to deliver (fun fact : It also gets auto-corrected to Delhi Board on my phone, which always makes me laugh and think of home).

Whoa Whoa Whoa! Hold on Ike's, you have a contender! Ever since my friend introduced my to Deli Board, I've been a huge fan. Love their sandwiches! They do not skimp you out of meat. In fact, they are very generous in the amount of meats and toppings in their sandwiches. My goal is to try each one down the menu list.
The butternut squash sandwich was great. Also lusting after the dishes of everyone around me. Will be back to try more of their menu

Loveddddd this place! The bread was soft and melt in my mouth and the lamb was superb!!! I had the lamb sandwich and I will be back for more! Additionally, I had excellent customer service!!! You MUST come here, this place is quality!!!
Delicious sandwiches and salads from a family run business.  Great lunch option if you're in the area.

First, the place smelled like heaven. I had the Kale and white bean salad with chicken. Perfect. I'm a very picky salad guy but no qualms at all, this is good. My companion had the pork belly sandwich and said, "It's soooo good."  Not much I can add to that!

There are a ton of sandwich spots for lunch in the downtown area and recently I have been unhappy with most of them. As such I didn't have very high hopes when trying out this place for a lunch adventure. It turned out to be a pleasant surprise.
The one star is for their service.
It's alright, nothing really stands out. You probably won't be disappointed or enthused.

Ordered the turkey breast sandwich and heirloom tomatoe soup...was only seated for a few minutes before my sandwich arrived, about a minute later my soup arrived . Absolutely one of the best lunch spots for people who care about quality food and have limited time. Great dining experience all the way around
Pretty good but the wait and service sucks.  Way to busy at lunch so pre order or they will forget about you
AMAZING Kale salad!!

I went here for lunch because I wanted to try something new.  I got the beef cheek sandwich and it was pretty damn amazing.  The beef cheeks were really tender, with roasted bell peppers, but I didn't get the cheese.  Overall the sandwich was really tasty and moist, a little on the fatty side.  It came with a simple but well dressed arugula salad.  The whole thing was $11.41, tax included.  Kind of pricey, but I will be back to try the Moroccan lamb.
Whoah!!! Just stumbled in and what a surprise, great samich! Btw had the turkey.

I went there a second time.  This time around I asked for a small substitution for my sandwich.  It seemed to have been a big deal for some reason.  Anyway, the chef himself delivered the sandwich to me which I thought was kind of strange since he didn't do that for anyone else.  I hadn't eaten all day and was very hungry.  I did not feel well at all after eating the sandwich and for a few days after that.  I won't go back.
This place is great - I just moved into the neighborhood and was looking for a quick but decent bite to eat two of the days I was unpacking
Pleasant staff, nice seating, good sandwiches.

I stopped by to get an iced latte on my way to the DMV and the first sip I was like, "Holy crap. This is the best latte I've ever tasted"... and then after that, it wasn't that great. I kind of think their ice cubes change the flavor of the drink a little bit.
4 stars, and 5 napkins!

Walked by this place with a co-worker and I'm glad we stopped by. Tasty food, nicely presented, and the ambiance/public is pleasant too. Enjoyed it. Will recommend it to my other colleagues. Good luck with your business!
Don't come for breakfast. You'll be disappointed.
I'm updating my review because my recent visits to V-105 were much improved. The sandwiches and salads are great and the place has a nice atmosphere.

This place is a neighborhood gem. The food is gorgeous, locally sourced, and more gourmet than most options in this price point. It's obviously made with love because the cafe is run by a husband-wife team. I have a hard time deciding what to order there when I watch the food being prepared because it all looks so good, but my recommendation is the portabella sandwich on house-made focaccia. It'll make your day.

Came here one afternoon for lunch. The chef behind the counter don't look esp. happy that day (in part due to a customer in front of me asking for the wrong thing), but I forged ahead anyway and got the mango chai and the brisket special.

I've had the Crispy Pork sandwich, Moroccan Lamb sandwich, and Bacon Mac & Cheese, which were all remarkably good. The sandwiches come with multiple layers of tasty condiments and side salads, which justifies the price for me. The service has been consistently slow, but the kind owners and flavorful fixings push this place over the edge in my opinion. Check it out for a low-key lunch with friends or co-workers.

Great little lunch place in a less congested part of Valencia. Parking is actually fairly easy here during the day. Good selection of salads and sandwiches, and the food is very fresh and tasty. I had the portabella mushroom sandwich with an arugula side salad and it was excellent.

One of the best lunches i have had anywhere. I had the crispy pork belly sandwich My friend had the Moroccan lamp sandwich. We also had the Cesar salad which was also very good. I will return and hope it becomes a part of the area.  I loved it

LOVE LOVE LOVE them here! The owners run the place and they are incredibly nice. The staff are as friendly ad they come. I have yet to have something on the menu that I do not like. Yes, I have in fact had almost everything on the menu.
This place was lovely.  Their lemonade was tasty, the chicken sandwich I had was delicious and not insanely large, service with a smile and good WiFi.  I'll happily go back

I can't tell which is sweeter-- the lamb or the employees! I work in customer service and I don't have any idea what these people are trippin about with their crabby reviews. Maybe they're sourpusses themselves cause this little boy right here walked in and got a free cookie with his lambwich.
Danielle and Susy are beautiful, kind people with a uniquely wonderful place to eat in SoMa.

Unbelievably amazing. Their fresh, house made bread is delicious and the sandwiches they come up with are very balanced and delicious. My favorite sandwich so far is the pork, with the portobello as a close second. The only sandwich I didn't like was chicken and apple, but I appreciate the attempt at interesting flavor combinations.
Best sandwich I've had in a while :) Roasted butternut squash with all the trimmings on homemade focaccia. Delicious! Can't wait to go back!

Ingredients still seem fresh but seasoning is a bit bland.  The smoothly pureed cauliflower soup was creamy but lacked flavor.  The side arugula salad was half dressed but still fresh. Don't forget to bring a bag for togo orders.  Not sure if they provide it with a fee but they didn't offer it, as I walked out with items three-story piled high.

Absolutely loved the lamb sandwich! Reasonably priced and original. Will be back to try their vegi sandwich and salads. Everything looked great. Outdoor seating however is a table or two on the busy street. Really could use a parklett.
I always get the butternut squash sandwich on salted focaccia bread with tomato, avocado, side of arugula salad. Primo!
My favorite lunch destintion. Wish it was open on the weekends and evenings.

This place does "simple" exceptionally.  Small, approachable menu...great sounding combinations of flavors and very tasty food. Truffled Mac and Cheese was great, fruit based salad was incredible and roasted turkey sandwich was well executed.  Would come back!
The beef cheeks focaccia sandwich is amazing!

Great spot for lunch! Always hits the spot and I wish I knew how to make that little side salad they give with all their sandwiches. The only thing- it's a little pricy for lunch. I like to keep my lunches to under 10 bucks in the city. Sometimes this goes a little bit over.
Great sandwiches, salads and drinks. What more could you ask for? It's surprisingly not difficult to get a table during lunch...surprising because this is a superlative spot.
'Wich don't kill my vibe, 'Wich V-105, I can feel your tastiness from two planets awayy

I think you have got to be drunk to like this place (which I imagine, most who eat here are). The food comes cold and in small portions, also incredibly salty. Not quality stuff, but cheap! Spaghetti bread was stale last two times I ordered it. The chicken waffles are pretty good, but the machine has been broken the last few times I've stopped by. The workers are always very nice and cracking jokes, but that's sort of the only thing to rave about while waiting for your cold food in the icy, dark alley. Who would've guessed that the world's missing hospitality would be found at a little hole-in-the-wall?

Great food! Little hole in the wall, got the chicken sandwich, bread awesome, spicy like mayo sauce with coleslaw. Totally will go back for the food. Only disappointment is that it is down a kinda dark street at night, and although it's next to a bar, there seemed to be many homeless people wondering by. I had my 10 year old son with me it was around 9ish and some drunk homeless man kept walking hovering the area taking about very negatively about himself and his race. It was not a good waiting around experience with my son.
great food but last time i came it was to salty.
Nothing like good food to counteract all the alcohol you've been drinking next door. That basically sums up Box Kitchen for me.
Food was good, came it fast, service in the window was super friendly. Very convenient spot and you can bring it in to Tempest while you're drinking, "high five!"

Perfect place for a late night bite! We got the falafel wrap, fried mac and cheese balls and the chicken in waffle. Everything was prepared fresh and tasted delicious. The chicken inside the waffle was quite interesting and came with a delicious maple Sriracha sauce. There isn't any seating as it is literally a little box, but you could walk to the nearby neighbourhoods or just stand outside and eat, like we did!
My last trip wasn't the best simply because I ordered a well done burger and received a burger that looked fresh out the slaughter house oozing with blood and juices. I haven't been back since, ugh!
Cool place, food didn't blow me away.
Best hole in the wall, ever.  Little pricy without a doubt but it'll fill your late night cravings with incredible,  greasy,  original menu options. It's all great, you can't go wrong here.

This place is an alley that I drive down every night to get home and I never noticed it until I was hangry one night and jumped on Yelp.  OMG, the Box burger and garlic fries were amazing...best burger that I have had in SF.  The burger was juicy, flavorful, and paired nicely with the garlic fries.  As for the service, they were friendly and my order didn't take too long even though it was made to order.
What I ordered:

potato skins with quail eggs at a gross, loud dive bar on Natoma @ 5th. St. I met someone in the area and wanted to try this dish. I don't know how the place is rated as highly as it is... Maybe it's decent for the area. What a shit show. Granted, I can't stand dive bars in grimy areas.

I came here with a friend before catching a movie at the Metreon. It was about a 7 minutes walk away. Box Kitchen is in an alley way next to a bar (Tempest) or maybe it was connected to the bar. It seemed sketchy with all that.

This place is a great little hole in the wall, literally. There are no seats to speak of and you order your food at the door and they call your name out.  The good is really great and satisfying.  I had the salt and vinegar fries and the Chicken sandwich, I was not disappointed.  I only had one complaint my fried who is celiac couldn't be assured of a gluten free meal. All else was amazing.
Better than expected burger and excellent garlic fries. Burger patty was perfect. Overall a bit fatty but good. Positively surprised, would go again.

Where have you been all my life, Box Kitchen? You taste excellent sober; I can't wait to taste you drunk. You're a beacon of light in a falling apart alleyway; you're the hole-in-the-wall that San Francisco needs and deserves. If you're asking "What? Why does a dive bar's outside food window have rave reviews? Why is it open for lunch?" I have no answers to your questions, but you must come and experience Wonderland for yourself.
Burgers and garlic fries here are mouth watering.

This is literally a hole in the wall place. It is a hole in a brick wall. It was pretty busy and it did take quite a while to get our food. I ordered the potato skins which was $9 for 3 potato skins... which is 1.5 potatoes. I'm used to getting at least 6 potato skins and for a cheaper price. But anyway, the potato skins had cheese like normal, but also had pork belly and a quail egg on them...... I was not a fan. I also tried someone else's garlic parmesan fries which I debated getting and I'm glad I did not get them. They were just meh.
Open from 4:20p.m. :) to 2:00a.m. The Chicken Sandwich!!!

Yum yum yum yum yummmmm. This place is effing delicious. I've passed by it a few times and never really took notice to it. But thank god was around this place when my belly started to grumble. My boyfriend got the ribs, which I forced him to share with me once I took a bite and was unable to stop funneling them into my black hole of a mouth. I got the garlic fries and the elote which is their corn on a cob. Both delicious. The garlic fries were bomb and the elote I couldn't help but moan with every bite.
I go here all the time and have had most of the menu. All very good but I'm not a huge fan of the felafel wrap.

This place is a sweet hole in the wall find. Order at the door and they call your name. People are super chill. Great quality and right next door is tempest if you wanna get a drink. Definitely recommend it for a late night bite.
Food: 3
Above-average bar food, served with an XXL side of IDGAF.

Burger was good, but I wish the cashier tonight told me earlier that they ran out of burger buns and gave me I think sour dough (which I don't like). Told him I wanted to go and he got that wrong... He might be tired, but so am I... I even tipped him too and I don't think he even noticed.
Chicken. And. Waffles.

Not sure how this place earned 5 stars but it is definitely not worthy of 5 stars. I had  ordered garlic fries ($5), salt and vinegar fries ($6) and tacos barbacoa ($7) so was expecting nothing but goodness.
Wow.  I could say this is the best burger I have ever had.  I could also say this is the best meal I have had in SF.

This is the place to visits for a delicious quality late night meal that will NOT disappoint. We are so delighted to have found this little gem through yelp and they really do have one of the best burgers we have ever had. Although $8 might be a bit much for just the burger and no sides, but trust me, everything about this place is amazing. We also really enjoy the fact that they change their menu frequently but at the same time keep their best items permanent. The neighborhood is very shady, but hey, for food this good at 12am, I'll take my chances.

A literal hole in the wall. Had the honey mustard chicken sandwich and a coconut. Expected more, to be honest, from the reviews for this place. The sandwich was decent. Would probably come back and try something else, but was pretty expensive for the back alley soup kitchen vibe. The coconut was perfect.

This place was awesome! Great food. We had the honey mustard chicken sandwich, pork tacos, and queso. It was all amazing! Great flavor, and fresh ingredients. I  also thought it was super reasonably priced for San Francisco. Definitely a pretty sketch neighborhood from the looks, but we didn't run into any trouble in the block in a half we walked or while waiting for our food--which was ready super quick.

Ok stayed at Intercontinental on Howard St. I wanted some other than room service. Great late night food! We could not decide so we purchased corn on the cob, box burger, honey chicken sandwich, potato skins and the garlic fries. Best was the Box Burger. Area was suspect so don't walk by yourself. We left San Fran yesterday and we are still talking about the concert, Crustacean and the Box Burger!

Let me start off by saying that I was SO sad they didn't have the chicken in waffles when I came here last night. I risked my life walking through the SUUPER shady alley way and hunting for a parking spot on Market, all I wanted was chicken IN my waffles.

The burger I got here was delicious -- especially the tomatoes. You know how much burgers' tomatoes are kind of.. bland? These tomatoes, I have no idea where they got them but they taste divine, juicy, and red, unlike any tomatoes I have ever tasted on a burger. The other ingredients were top notch too, but for some reason the tomatoes were the most memorable.
Pretty cool, great for late night.
Food is super tasty, but its in a sketchy back alley. Order the chicken sandwich, bring mace.... oh and a pop if you dont plan to hit the bar. No drinks here.
Scary neighborhood, parking meters, back alley hole in the wall, next to a rowdy, er I mean lively bar (Tempest).
Great late night food.

Okay , this burger could easily go for 35 bucks in a primo restaurant. The guys who started the swanky bar next door opened this place for drunk eats. They applied their culinary acumen and the result is our benefit. Nothing price-to-value wise is better. Go for it.

Holy crap, this was good (i.e. the Box Burger). It's the kind of place you want to call a hidden gem, but yet any yuppie or hipster in SF knows about it already. I'm sure the backlash is gestating at a minimum, so here's my part to stem the tide. This is a legitimate contender for the best burger I've had - I can't think of one I like better. I'm from Dallas and I've eaten a ton there - Dallas is a great burger town. This was my first in SF and it pains my right-leaning self to say this trumps all in Dallas. I ate in the dark so couldn't see exactly what was elevating it to these heights, but upon ravaging this sandwich in the course of two city blocks, I inspected the barren box and I do believe I discovered pancetta bits. Cheating? Perhaps, but it's not like there weren't two buns and a beef patty in there too. Young Darryl couldn't imagine saying it, but, at $8 this was a bargain.

Love coming here for brunch - they're always playing great music and it's affordable.  The bagel plate is a perfect light meal.  The eggs & hash is delicious and very filling if you've got a big appetite.  On Saturdays, they have fresh donuts in the attached bakery (Pinkie's) and the flavors are different every week. If you miss out on the donuts, the chocolate bread is always a win
Wow. I can't believe I'm writing my first negative review.
I've been going to Pinky's somewhat regularly (the bakery next door; same owner) and wanted to try Citizen's Band as I was very pleased with the pastries at Pinky's (especially the quiche).
Poutine is incredible, fried chicken sandwich is incredible, pastries are incredible, staff is incredible
This review is for lunch/dinner.
Great place to eat...small menu, but what they have is amazing. The cooks are perfect at what they do. Excellent dive!!!!
I'm going to give this place 4 starts because the combination of the food and service is really good for the type of restaurant that this is.
The food was pretty good. I got a cheeseburger with fries. My wife got the Mac and cheese, it was also good. We got a few beers and we got out for under $40. Not too bad.

Burger was fantastic. Perfectly medium rare just like I ordered, and adding the egg made it even juicier. I did not have the problem that some others have reported of cold or overcooked. The bacon was worth the extra cost as well.

This place definitely has a different vibe to it. Reminds me of an old diner filled with old photographs, old radios and magnets. The kitchen is open which is pretty cool if you enjoy watching that stuff.

We dined here on a Friday night and enjoyed the food but thought it was nothing special. The fried chicken was a bit dry but otherwise tasty. The poutine was a little bland and would have been much improved by some more seasoning. I didn't try the burger but my friend liked it. The service was good and I liked the ambiance overall.
Cool concept - good music - but food simply didn't deliver. Burger was tasteless and overcooked, bacon was undercooked and not even tasty - and deviled eggs were as average as can be.

I had the most amazing culinary adventure here the other night.  I was hungry and feeling pretty lazy so cooking and walking far to dinner were out of the question.  That was when I discovered that this gem was only a 5 minute walk away from my place.  I made a reservation on OpenTable and upon entering I was immediately seated at the counter.  The menu had a bunch of things that I wanted to try, but I ultimately decided on the burger with an egg on top and the fries.  The burger was of the Kobe variety, was juicy on the inside, had a nice crust on the outside, and was perfectly seasoned to give it a great flavor.  The combination of the burger, bun, cheese, egg, pickles, and mayo were perfect and the fries were a great match.  Before I knew it, I had polished it off and I rarely can polish off an entire plate of fries and burger unless I haven't eaten anything earlier in the day.
Well, I really, really wanted to like this place.  I mean, the menu looked really promising. However, the taste is what they failed to deliver.

Overview...Came here for a bite with friends before heading to a show nearby. We all arrived at 6:30pm per our reservation and was seated quickly. We mentioned to our waitress that we were in a hurry and needed to leave by 7:45-8pm. An hour was sufficient eating/scarfing down food time, right?!? She said of course. Not a problem.

LOVE this place!!  It had been years since I ate there, but the minute I put some of the yummy mac and cheese in my mouth the tasty memories came back to me.  I can't tell you what we ordered as it was more a case of what we DIDN'T order!!!  My favorites are the mac and cheese...I mean come on it comes with a stack of onion rings!!!  Who wouldn't LOVE that??!!  The fried chicken is moist on the inside and crispy on the outside!

This was recommended by friends, and turned out to be everything they praised. The service is quick and friendly, we set by some locals that come every week. The food was amazing and the portions were more than we could eat. Everything was the right temperature and very delicious. Must visit.

Decided to order delivery from citizen's band through caviar, which i instantly regretted. My gf and i ordered the steak dish which costed $28 dollars and the poutine fries which cost $10. When I opened the box it looked like I only got half of a steak that was cut up into 4 pieces and a bunch of corn...NOT what I expected! Did you guys forget the other half or did you just gather up a bunch of left over scraps and just throw in the box because for $28 that's definitely not worth it. The fries was the worst out of the two because there was NO GRAVY on my poutine. The gravy is pretty much an essential part which makes it a POUTINE!  If you want to get ripped off then, order from citizens band.

I wanted to try this place, but didn't have time for a sit down dinner. I heard so much about their Mac and cheese and I had to try it. So I called in my order for take out. Let me tell you the Mac and cheese did not disappoint! To top it off it's served with three huge onion rings.  The only knock I would give it, is that it wasn't enough Mac for the price, but I would definitely go back again.
Dive accurately describes it. The food is good but pricey. Chicken is $23. I had the Mac n cheese. Interesting but good. Came with onion rings on top and some really salty ham.

Well,  it kind of looked like a divey place, to be honest.  We looked in, and there was no one at the door. No signs saying" please wait to be seated" or anything. After a moment, when we were not greeted, shrugging inwardly, we walked in and took a seat at one of the empty tables. The seats were uncomfortable,  the noise level was obnoxiously high, and no, music, I'm afraid I am not down with OPP. After sitting for about 5 minutes, wondering if we were supposed to order burgers and fries from a counter somewhere, a woman approached and said "excuse me, but do you have a RESERVATION?"

Good food for after you've been drinking!  We had the poutine (pretty good), steak (ew awful), Mac n cheese with bacon (THE BEST WHEN YOU'RE DRUNK), and cauliflower (REALLG TASTY STUFF).  I don't understand why the steak is so expensive when it's not very good.  But everything else was surprisingly delicious!  Makes me almost want to move to San Francisco haha~~
The website reads "Fusing white tablecloth caliber food with the comfort

Was excited to try a new restaurant and enjoy a yummy meal with friends. Unfortunately, the experience at Citizens Band left me disappointed, disgusted and embarrassed for the chefs, especially because I myself am a chef.

The only reason we came in here for dinner is that we were in the neighborhood and they seem to have pretty good Mac'n'Cheese and burgers according to Yelp reviews. We arrived around 8pm and the restaurant is almost half empty, so we were able to find seats right away. I liked the laid-back atmosphere and their small menu.
Wouldn't go out of my way for it. Not knowing San Francisco, it's not in a neighborhood I would choose to go for ok food.
Delicious!!! Had the watermelon salad, so refreshing. Also had the hamburger and carrot cake. Both to die for!! This place is a must try.

The hostess was pretty spectacularly rude and the food was just okay, for the price. The waitress was nice enough, but she kept interrupting conversation every ten minutes in an effort to turn our table. Meh about sums it up.

I've had my eye on citizen's band ever since I saw that they had a poutine dish with pork belly. Being honest with myself, pretty much anything with pork belly is going to draw my attention. This was no different. So when I was looking through my list of places to try, I settled on this place since it is in the SoMa area and no more than a miles walk away.

Was excited to try this place after reading the menu and reviews.  So I would say don't eat here on a hot day.  It was hot in SF and we baked while trying to enjoy our dinner.  The ladies that served us were nice and attentive.
Yummy updated Southern food.  You want to come here with a couple people and share an entree plus a few sides.

Comfort food for sure!  Started with the caramelized cauliflower which was simply done to perfection.  Enjoyed the Kobe burger with clue cheese and it was to die for!  Great atmosphere and service, and enjoyed having the open kitchen!  Would definitely recommend and come again!
Had a very nice lunch here last week and I suspect that it will become one of my lunch spot go-tos.
Holy cow this is good stuff. Came here for lunch today and left about five pounds heavier and in desperate need for a food coma nap.
Overpriced and Just Average

Get the poutine!  Well, everything's great here.  But the poutine is the best I've had, including the places in Vancouver that are supposed to be renowned for it.  Just make sure you exercise a lot afterwards.  Make that beforehand too.

I personally like it when restaurants have short menus, much like Citizen's Band does. This is because I'm indecisive, but also because I think that the shorter the list, the better and more specialized the food. Eh, my theory could be wrong.
Cool and laid back cafe. I really liked the hipster feeling of the place and definitely not over-pretentious.

I went for dinner on a Friday night. Great, because there was no line, no wait at all, but it was underwhelming. I love the space and the food was delicious, although it was a bit expensive for what we were getting (the veggie entree - delicious - but didn't feel worth the nearly 20 bucks.
Great comfort food, nice and attentive staff and such a cute place. Glad I just moved to the neighborhood. I willl be coming here often.
no not good compared to crepes in Japantown in my opinion.  but that can be because I am an Asian lol.  the crepe part is too thick.  content is too plain.
Well, you would think you can't go wrong with a banana-nutella crepe.
LOVE this place - its a curse that I live around the corner.

Not phenomenal crepes but great late night spot when you're hungry.  They have dessert and savory crepes and a pretty extensive menu.  I think the nutella fruit crepes are the best.  Will definitely go back cause it's a chill spot.
Across the street from Bootie. Tasty savory and sweet crepes. What more do you need to know?
Fantastic staff and great savory crepes.  Will definitely go back
I wouldn't call the crepes here, "crepes".  Crepes are supposed to be paper thin, but the "crepes" here are more like thin pancakes.

I think the cause of Crepes A Go Go's high rating is the fact that it's located down the street from a lot of bars. In other words, it's drunk food, and drunks like anything... unless they're angry drunks. Heck, a drunk guy even complimented my Ninja Turtle t-shirt. Well, now that I think about it, that drunk at least did have good taste.
For the price, time of day and level of happiness it provided, I will give it a 4 star!

Gotta becareful here. They think you're drunk and will over charge you. They'll nickel and dime you without you knowing.  They'll even do it on the tax.  When questioned,  the owner said the tax rate is 9.75%, when in fact is 8.75%. I bet they don't even pay the tax they collect to the gov't. Shady.  Just be sure to calculate everything yourself and be very specific about what you order.
Heard the craze over crepes a go go many times before, but finally got to try it last Saturday.. totally lives up to the hype, it was delicious!!
Absolutely stunning crepes:) The best I have had so far. I would recommend the Nutella and kiwi :)
Hungry in the middle of the night? Go here! Sweet and savory crepes at your rescue!
Funny guys with good customer service. Always enjoy my crepe no matter which one I choose.

GREAT late night eats after a night out. Anything you order is good (because I had a bite of all of my friends' food) but I really enjoyed my own crepe (the grilled chicken sauteed in onions, garlic, and peppers). My friend ordered a savory crepe and also a sweet crepe and was double fisting his food the whole time. He told me that I needed to order two, which I thought was excessive, but good thing I listened to him. My chicken crepe wasn't enough. I was hooked and needed more! So I got the nutella strawberry and raspberry crepe topped with whip cream. Mmm!
Pretty good crepes.  I like that this place is open super late in a city that tends to close rather early.   I liked that they let me go off menu on my crepe contents.
This place gets 4 stars instead of 5 because the new guys just lack the old owners' enthusiasm and friendliness.

This place was SO satisfying after a long night of drinking next door. We walked out of the bar and I wished I could have gotten street meat (Seattle staple). Not something you find on the streets of SF, but crepes worked! You can't be picky when drunk and hungry.
Ok.  The one on Polk is much better.  These guys act like they hate their jobs.  Also, located in a food truck in a dicey area.  You feel as though your'e going to get mugged...
Perfect late night joint...smack in the middle of all the clubs and bars. They must make a killing in profits.
If you're looking for a fast, sweet snack while at the pier this is the place for you. They make pretty decent crepes and fairly quickly too.

In this desolate part of town, there's not much open after 11pm. So where to go? Crepes A Go Go on a mid week show it's pretty light. I can only imagine if Friday and Sat night prime time drunko time is like. Got a solid smoked turkey and cheese. Tried a friend's nutella sweet crepe too. Straight up unfussy handheld foods for your late night munching
How is it that all these years of partying in SF and this is the first time we saw this place?!

What an ideal after-hours/post drinking spot conveniently located a street from my bldg. Although, I am rarely a fan of late night eats that involve a carb overload..my friends had to eat and so they ended up trying it and I had a little and it was all pretty good for that late hour!
This is a great crepe place to visit for a late night snack in SoMa. The sweet crepe with butter and sugar is superb and just like crepes in France.
jesus tits...just like any vice can be met in this town granted one has the means.  this place next to butter is proof any food item you crave, reminisce or can think up is also made available

After working an event at the nearby DNA Lounge I was feeling peckish and wanted to get something sweet before heading home. Hidden away on 11th St next to Butter was the crepe truck. $2.50 for a simple sugar and butter and crepe sure hit the spot. Since the crepes seemed to be made ahead of time (there was a visible stack of them) they only had to put together the toppings and off we go.

Our friends brought us here for a midnight snack. Didn't know what to expect since I didn't realize they were taking us to a food truck. One friend suggested the Crepes Ooh la la with cheese, beef, green onions, green olives, jalapeños, sour cream, and Italian parsley for $9. Seemed a bit steep price wise, but it was so good. I was full, but since it was so tasty, I actually ate half of the order. It was a bit spicy for my husband, but I would definitely get it again. Maybe I'll try the more affordable item next time, the cheese, beef, grilled jalapeños and onions for $7.50.
Nutella Banana crepe is awesome

Something must have changed. This time I didn't get a fresh crepe like they did before and got a pre-cooked one that was reheated. So many crepe options that they are priced weird. A Nutella strawberry banana crepe is $0.50 more than just a Nutella strawberry crepe with a banana add-on.  If you ask to do the add-on they just charge you for the expensive one. I guess when your drunk no one catches that.
Unbelievably good crepes, the best I've ever had. Service is friendly and fast, and prices are good.

Well, this is a great late night truck that stays open until 4Am. It has been identified as one of San Francisco's landmarks. Great and quick service, staff always clean and prompt. I admire the owner for his personality and exceptional customer service, one of the characteristics of successful businessman. Keep up the good work.

It was Friday night and I was planning on staying in. I was tired and sore from the gym, but my friends decide to kidnap me and make me fat. First stop was Arang, then it was Kowloon Tong, a round of pool at Family's and then Crepes A Go Go.

Out of 5 stars I would of given this place a zero. They gave me a triple whammy. I was over charged, food poisoned, and received unfriendly service. Whatever you do... Do not order anything with mushrooms they are tainted. I'm still feeling the side effects and it's horrible.
yumm!
BOMB DIGGITY Crepes in a sketchy part of town.

MMM this is a trailer in soma that has a whole tons of crepes. They're open so late! I run club nights at a venue a couple buildings away, and this is perfect for a snack at 3am.  The crepes themselves aren't heavy like some are here in SF, and i was totally sober. They are easy to eat by hand before, after or during one of the nearby clubs, and a healthier and yummier option than getting greasy pizza. Cash only, but there's an atm at the convenience store nearby. There's also a little outdoor seating, and the people who run it are friendly. I really liked the ricotta applesauce crepe.

AWESOME crepes! I've had three here and they've all been incredible both in flavor combination and in portion! I guess my only qualm with this place is that if you show up after 1.30AM, the prices are doubled. So if you're out for a heavy night of drunken debauchery and are craving that crepe afterwards, be sure to drunkenly stumble on over before 1:30... Mind you, there's also a sizable crowd...
This place is be!

This place is PERFECT after a night of being drunk!  Well this would have to do since there isn't a good mexican food place in the bay.  I love crepes!  I had the nutella with bananas and it was sooo good.  Great late night snack!

Trying to figure out why this place is a 3 Michelin Star restaurant....  The service was amazing, but there are no words to describe the level of disappointment with how bland the food is. I kept hoping I would be WOWed, but ended the meal w a level of guilt for paying close to $450 for subpar, tiny, buttery food. I do not recommend. Entirely wayyyy toooo expensive.!!!!!!!!!!

I'll keep my review concisely focused on our experience, as the food is consistent and highlighted extensively in other reviews. For background, we had the discovery menu for two a few weeks prior to this review.

We've been lucky enough to eat here three times - once at the original location and twice at the new one. To be honest, we both really enjoyed the ambiance at the original location better. The food is still great, although it's not as surprising after the first experience. I wish they had changed things up as a lot of time had passed between the visits. This generally means that we will be unlikely to ever go back unless we hear of a shift in the menu or style, etc.. That said, the food and the inventiveness is impeccable. The staff are fun and friendly, giving Saison a lightness that offsets the seriousness of the very-visible kitchen. Watching the kitchen is still fascinating, and the whole team is (as I recall) wonderfully diverse, which we noticed.
