good food. worth going back.
Factory Dining

From the viewpoint of two avid foodies who have dined in the best restaurants around the world, Saison is a destination unto itself. The discovery menu and the wine pairings blew us away! Impeccable, attentive, yet unintrusive service is definitely something to write home about. Ask for a table opposite the kitchen: watching these masters work was like listening to a perfectly orchestrated and executed symphony! Bottom line, from stem- and tableware selections to the restrooms smelling like a flower garden, no detail in this place is overlooked! Simply perfect!  If you can bear the prices, make a point to try this fantastic food temple! Bravo, Chef Josh and team! Congrats on the very well deserved 3 Michellin stars!

The service was amazing. I sat at the bar, which I believe made my experience even better, as I got to watch Samuel make all the cocktails and mocktails. He even creates his own drinks to cater to what taste he thinks you prefer. Definitely get one of those!
A different kind of degustation... flavors are clean and light that you will not feel bloated after the meal.
A serious focus on food.
For our 7th year anniversary we decided to splurge,

I had their tasting menu and my dining companion as well but with wine pairing. And we were seated at the bar. I could not even remember how many courses it was.  Food kept coming! Food was inventive and thoughtful as I would expect. And I appreciated that each course was presented by someone who actually cook in the kitchen.  When the bill was settled, they brought my car key with the receipt.  It was nice touch!  The bill was about $1000 including the tip! Ugh. Overall great food, great service, and nice ambiance.  So you know you have to factor the high price in my review... was it worth $1000? Personally I am not sure.  However I am positive that you will impress any dining companion if you treat her/him here.  :)

We are here celebrating my husband bday today. Everything is perfect, food, service and environment. However one thing is really disturbing. The cute chef keep licking the spoon after he placed food into the bowl. Everytime he lick it he will wipe it with the towel he has..... Is that really disgusting?!?!? It doesn't happen once it happens everytime he places good. Guess how many germs u get from this cute looking chef!!
This is by far the best restaurant I have been to in San Francisco.

Wonderful dining experience.....Saison is a very warm and inviting space, with all staff members working in concert to make sure we felt welcome, special, and completely invited to enter there culinary world. We went on a wine night, so there were less dishes and more wine tastings, but some food highlights included a smoked trout in a warm broth, their "fire in the sky" slow-roasted beet, and bites of fire-roasted lamb. Although extremely expensive, I would actually go again some time.

My second time eating there and was surprised that another table next to ours got a different version of a dish with a really NICE piece of UNI on it. I asked why, and was brushed off as something "Chef" decides. If "Chef" decides, you might want to inquire with the CHEF to put you on the good list so you get the better ingredients/dishes. Since the menu has only one option (no upgrades) just left us feeling confused why this other table got better ingredients then us.

Came here for my birthday and I was very delighted with the whole experience. I made reservations a few weeks in advance and even then the only dinner reservation they had available was 5.30 pm but since I wanted to go here on my birthday, I took it. The waitress told me that our table had a view, and I wondered what view she was talking about given the location. Once there, I found out what the view was; the kitchen! We were seated right across from the kitchen where the magic happens, I could look at those chefs meticulously cooking and plating all night long. We had a corner table and the pillows just make you feel at home!
This update is just for the bar.
I had to save my 2500th review because I wanted to make it something special.

Was it worth it? If you like metro men in suits coming out explaining every single dish. Haha. This was a bit entertaining. On a serious note, it was nice the chefs (sous, pastry, etc, but not Skenes himself) came out to present each dish. The bill was over $3k for a party of 5. I didn't even do the wine pairings due to my current condition.
The parade of spoons!!
Exceptional food and service. Have showned their placement in the world ranking. Food was very well prepared very detailed. Plating equipment was very delicate. Will hope to see them climb up more!
Mind blowing. The best Michelin star restaurant I have been to by far.

These people are doing some of the most meticulous and interesting food anywhere, and they seem to be able to charge for it.  It's kind of a weird combination of casual and exceptionally fancy, though.  Perhaps it's a conflict between customer expectations given the price and a desire for a more casual experience on the part of the restaurant.

We has the 21 course tasting menu and it was a great experience. We are world travelers and foodies and give it 9.5 yo. 9.8 out of 10   This is one of the top 10 places we dined at.  Most dishes were close to a wow with 2-3 wow dishes. The uni with avocado and the ribeye were clear wows. Only suggestion was they should give petty-fords at the end. To me anyone giving this a negative review is not a foodie and or does not have the money to fine at fine dining    This just a tad shy of French laundry and similar to places like Altiere-creme. I would go back
With Saison's new digs came an exorbitant new price tag: a $248/person menu with no booze. Pre-tax. Pre-tip. And, that's the cheapest menu.
Items Enjoyed:
Food - Epic
Food : 3.8 stars
Took the bf here for his birthday and this is the best restaurant in SF.  I dare you to find better :)   Saison for SF is like how EMP is for NYC.
Exorbitantly expensive for one of the most disappointing Michelin star meals I've ever had.
Be prepared to be a balla here just like at Benu.

Well...I've been here 4-5 times, the first of which was when they rented out the kitchen at their old location a couple of times a week and had a few seatings every week based on when they rented it out. I must say that I miss that experience (and price).

If you do not love fish, chances are you won't love Saison.  Luckily, we love fish.  On the regular tasting menu ($248.) out of 13 courses, 6 were fish (1 raw, 4 cooked, 1 caviar), 2 vegetables, 1 pigeon.  There was one I just can't remember other than it was a savory course with chocolate (very little) and foam on top.  It was some kind of whipped liver.  Very rich.  We really enjoyed it!  LOL
Oh how I wanted to love you, Saison. My date and I were really looking forward to the 20 course tasting menu and accompanying beverage pairings. Yet, here is where I struggle...
Splendid food and elegant presentations with a positive note on the service, too.  I've eaten, and actually enjoyed, certain edibles here that I had never had wanted to try.  It's that yummy.

Went here to celebrate a birthday.  They split the menu into two prices, one for $248 and another "discovery tasting" for $398.  We opted for the $248 meal.  We got a bottle of wine for the table.  After everything was said and done, the total came out to around $350 per person.
3-4 stars for the food, 2-3 stars for the service (I've been sitting on this review for over a year now, so things could have changed drastically by now..).

Speechless ...both the food and the service! Me and my mom went with the tasting menu, fantastic! the fish was fresh and tasty ...carefully prepared(eye witnessed, our table were facing the kitchen), the chef actually brought the food to us, extra points! and we were so lucky, the chef wrote down several restaurant recommendations in Chicago(special thanks to our awesome Maitre D'- Matthew who asked chef the favor) ...yes, we gonna try all of them! and cup of buckwheat tea and small treats before you checkout ...and a bag of small treats before you leave ...I mean, it was an awesome experience regardless of the price ...we felt very welcomed, cozy and comfortable from the beginning to the end ...Definitely coming back =D
Absolutely one of the best in SF!
Best meal of my life, go for the Discovery Menu! Expensive, but worth every penny. The cost for the most part is going straight into the ingredients/preparation.

I made reservations through yelp/open table for me and my +1. When I checked the confirmation email right before leaving, the wrong day was listed! I called Zero Zero and the lady at the front desk who I spoke to was SO nice- she accommodated us for that night! I was really impressed with their customer service- definitely added a star to my review for that gesture :) Shout out to the really nice host!

i was invited to a dinner at this place. Their food was fantastic, service was awsome but what i like the most is the ambiance of this place. Not too causal but not too formal. I like their pizza the most, especially the pizza with clam, it is quite unique.
I'am an out of town food enthusiast. Pizza is a favorite in my family. I split a Margherita pizza with my wife and it was amazing. Crust was nice and done while the cheese melted away.

Went here for brunch today and was so happy I did. The decor is excellent, the first thing you notice is the gorgeous bar display and the second floor seating. My friend and I were seated at a high top in the bar area and found it to be a great location for two friends that wanted to talk our way through lunch :)

Oddly enough, this restaurant doesn't strike me as "trendy" or "swanky," despite my expectations from previous  reviews. It's... dark, has a bar tended by bearded men, and has thumping music with a beat that makes it hard to chew, but it still feels more like an upscale Pizzeria Uno (and I don't mean that as an insult!) It's not a trendy crowd, either - lots of families and FiDi folks coming for drinks after work. Sigh of relief.
Went during the afternoon and only got to order a very basic pizza, but it tasted amazing.

Great customer service on the phone. Went to pick up my order. Bartender had no idea about the order and no server in the front. After getting my order pizza was cold a lacking in flavor. Along with pizza being personal size thinking it would be 10 dollars each. Order was 40 for two personal pizza. Never again!
Pizza is so personal. I mean, there's different styles, textures, thickness, flavors, and temperatures to eat it at.
Headline: caused food poisoning and flagship pizza was meh
Very very good pasta.  The duck rigatoni is lovely. Unfortunately the service we had left lots and lots to be desired.  5 stars if it weren't for the waiter.
After being told how amazing this place is, I'll admit my expectations were probably a little high.
Great quality and atmosphere, but can find better for the price.
Been coming here for years. My favorite pizza in SF. Try the ceasar salad and ricotta donut dessert!

My roommate and I trekked here all the way from North Beach because due to Fleet Week, it was actually faster to walk the more than two miles to SoMa than take a bus/uber/taxi. -_____-  Needless to say, I think anything would have tasted amazing by that point. That being said, Zero Zero is still pretty good.

Horrible customer service- probably the worst I have ever experienced. Called earlier in the day to confirm corkage and was told $20/bottle. We brought in 4 bottles and had already opened one, when the manager came over and literally acted like a sociopath saying we were only allowed to bring in 2 bottles max and we would not be permitted to open the other 2. I kindly advised him that his staff needs to be better informed because we received contradictory information, to which he said "I don't care. It is 2 bottles and that is it." These were $200+ bottles we had brought in to taste, not some crap from Safeway. We ended up going down the street to Oola where they were happy to open our wines and we repaid them in kind by ordering most everything off the menu. Zero Zero's loss.

I dined at Zero Zero last week with two friends.   We enjoy good food often and all of us were very impressed with the menu, flavors, service and ambiance.    Michael was our server and he was warm and attentive.  We enjoyed the rigatoni with duck, mushroom pizza, kale salad and yellowtail sashimi.   WOW!!!   The cheese is made in-house daily and you can tell.   I cannot wait to return.    Yummy cocktails were coming out from the bar so I'll try those next.

When a pizza place is named after a specific grade of flour, you know it's going to be good. I love the crispy, wood stove, Neapolitan-style pizzas, and this place had plenty of good flavor combinations to try.
Made a reservation through OpenTable for a Friday night and I'm glad we did because this place was very busy!

I went last night with a friend and it was both of our first times here. We went around 7 without reservations and although they were busy, we were able to be seated within 15 minutes. Probably because it was a Tuesday night.
My favorite pizza place in the City.  The Margherita Extra is delicious.  The soft-serve with olive oil and sea salt is a must.

I had the roasted corn carbonara pasta which was definitely really really tasty.  Others in my group had pizza and also said that it was really delicious.  We went in for lunch on a saturday afternoon and the place was full but we did not have to wait at all.  I'd go back here again to try the pizza that my friends had.
Great pizzas and sides. Nice wine list. Friendly service.
The food was fresh and the restaurant had a good buzz. The staff was friendly and I will go back again in the not too distant future.
This place is just amaze balls. lol.

I had the chance to come here the other day since I heard so much about this place. I'm a big fan of deep dish pizza, but I also like thin crust pizza as well if it's done right. This place definitely has their pizza on point, even though it's not the best I've had. Here's some highlights from my meal.

We were here early on a Saturday evening and had the opportunity to watch the place fill up and get busy - great atmosphere and great music playing. The chicory salad was particularly good, though perhaps too much dressing on the bottom half of the salad.  The Terroir cocktail was outstanding - St. George gin, basil, and huckleberries... Is come back just for this drink!!

Another year, another birthday dinner!  So glad we opted for a fun place this year, not the staid and more formal atmosphere of some place like Waterbar, where we were last year.  The moment we stepped inside, I liked the place. The decor is modern, but warm and inviting. The high ceiling makes it seem bigger than it is and the seating on the second floor allows for more diners.  The large half moon booths are perfect for bigger parties.
A very well-known pizza joint in SOMA and SF in general, expectations were pretty high when I finally made my way out here.
I have been there for dinner probably about 6 or 7 times by now.
If you like flavorful italian, you'll like Zero Zero.

While scoping for a dinner location within walking distance of the convention center, we happened upon Zero Zero and decided to try our luck. It was packed on a week night and since we didn't have reservations, we had a short wait.

Came here last night and sat at the bar. Amazing drinks- get the upstairs neighbor if you're a bourbon lover like myself. The arancini and pork belly appetizers were absolutely delicious as well! I'll definitely be back for more.

I must say, SOMA is turning into such a trendy place.  Granted it still feels a bit shady walking around at night, but there are some excellent bars and restaurants.  Zero Zero fits in as a great Italian restaurant (mostly pizza and pasta).  It has a low-lit, warm ambience that's great for a night out with friends.  Their bar is good to, with a big screen TV for watching sports.  Most importantly, the food was excellent.
Solid 4-Stars.

Excellent pizza, delicious drinks and a fun atmosphere.   I would have given Zero Zero five stars if it weren't for the miscommunication with the hostess.   We did not have a reservation, but we put our names down and were told there would be a 45-minute wait and were advised to hang out at the bar.   We ordered drinks and an appetizer (to hold us over) and after an hour, we approached the hostess to check in on when we would be seated.  She said that since she saw us eating, she assumed we no longer needed a table.   We were able to be seated, but still at the bar and not in an ideal location.  Oh well - I would still recommend this restaurant.
Yummy pizzas, they're a little bigger than individual pizza so can be shared. And all the appetizers are good too. The place itself is bit loud but lovely laid out and staff is friendly.
Duck Rigatoni - Delicious.
Delicious pizza, great appetizers and decent wine selections! Definitely a fan, just a bit loud and cramped.

Zero Zero is popularly known as a pizza joint, but I come here for their awesome pasta! They have some of the most interesting and delicious dishes on their seasonal menus that I absolutely adore. The rigatoni with tender duck is a winner and the gnocchi with bay shrimp, sweet corn, peppers, uni butter, and crunchy breadcrumbs is out of this world! The gnocchi is pan fried and not pasty like other places and the whole dish has harmonious flavors and textures that are just perfect together. My only complaint was that I wished there was more...it's my favorite!

I was walking around this around looking for a place to grab such delicious drinks and sit down for a bit before heading out of town and we found this place. It was surprisingly awesome. The place has an industrial-loft but comfy feel. All the reviews are pretty accurate. The staff was very attentive and friendly.  My bartender was part of the reason my review is 5 instead of 4 stars. He was so helpful and I loved hearing him share his knowledge on the area. I wish I could remember his name...I know it was D- something. If you get the chance to sit at the bar I would highly recommend him. He will make your drinks quick and strong with an added touch of personality. (Just how I like em'.) Can't wait to try this spot again for some weekly specials.
Their taco Tuesdays are deliciously cheap! Completely worth it.
Such a fun brunch spot! The lounge seating creates a really cozy and relaxing environment. The decor is eclectic but fun and overall falls into their lat american theme.
This is a great find in SF! Cozy/relaxed atmosphere, great food, great drinks and friendly service!
Great joint for a date or night out with friends. Super friendly staff and solid food.
Definitely a good find! Cool decor.
Azucar was packed due to an event this evening, but I still really enjoyed the drinks, food, and comfortable atmosphere.

Azucar is a great cantina/bar in my area of SOMA! I went here when I first moved to the area for cocktails with my roommate. The staff were all so friendly and welcoming, we did not get to try the food but I plan to go back for the taco tuesday!!

This little gem is amazing! The ambiance is perfect with great music and comfortable seating. The service was great and so was the happy hour. The happy hour food was so delicious! You must order everything on the happy hour menu. You won't regret It!

I had the best time here , I was there midday , only a couple people at the bar  after lunch,  but loved the place, the decor  was a combination,  Mexican Dia de Los Muertos  and folk art, junk store finds like an old TV in wood cabinet, and  Scandanavian  seating areas,  the  cook Edgar does delicious Philipino food at lunch  but I would recommend less adventurous eaters  skip the Sisig, it is a Phillipino specialty with a South of Market twist , the gravy was heavenly but the texture of the pork is off putting  to some ( includes the pigs ears as well as pork belly ) try the adobo or pancet,  the  Bloody Mary is made with pineapple juice, tomato juice, vodka and spices garnished with lime and a glas rimmed with  mexican spice, the best.   The staff were friendly and regulars talkative. , if you are wandering around this is an undiscovered unpretentious little place that I imagine would be  convenient  meeting point if  nearby.   Not sure what is in the neighborhood, they were filming a HBO special while I was there so outside was packed with TV trucks, while I was there Edgar was experimenting with different cocktails , they made a lot of their own bitters and syrups . I didn't try the desserts so don't know about that
Taco Tuesday is tacolicious. AYCE for about $10 and you have your choice of either meat or vegetarian.
Best tacos on Taco Tuesdays!  $10 for all you can eat. Delicious and cheap. Can't get any better than that!  And the staff are fun!

This is a fun place to go for taco Tuesdays! There's an all you can eat taco deal for around $10 and you have your choice of veggie or meat tacos. Their tacos aren't the most authentic, but are still tasty. Their drinks are good and there's also a margarita special on Tuesdays! I came here for a friends birthday and the staff were very fun and friendly and even gave us a round of shots on the house. If coming on a Tuesday, I'd definitely call ahead to make a reservation as the place gets pretty crowded.

This "Unlimited Taco Tuesday for $10" is a classic. They provide good service, and tacos are reasonably good for what you pay. Obviously they make cash with the drinks, which are pretty good as well. Overall a safe bet for a Tuesday evening.
Really cool place to chillax. No tables, just lounge chairs. Just bring a sober state of mind and leave happy with a smile, *hiccups*....
This place is amazing! The food and service was amazing! I love the look of the place too, didn't feel generic at all.

The entire staff was extremely rude. I ordered two tacos and traded one of them for one of my friend's bottomless tacos. Again, I ordered two tacos and are two tacos. I later understood this was against the policy but the way the waitress told us was in a very aggressive manner, accusing us rather than explaining calmly and listening to our reason for sharing. She proceeded to make it a much bigger deal than it needed to be. I understand that we did something 'wrong', but for her AND the manager to talk to us in an extremely rude way tells me they just do not care about giving good service.

Really enjoyed this place. The drinks were great- It is more of a lounge than a dinner place in my opinion. Their food menu wasn't extensive and if youre a picky eater it will be hard for you since there aren't that many options. All the drinks are good- i had the azucar azul or some drink like that.. it had blue in the name and our waiter was really funn and was really nice to us!
Nice place to have a margarita with some friends. The food is ok. Nice the app to chose the songs
Let us start with a haiku:
Nice Taco Tuesday deal. Yummy veggies tacos! Felt a bit rushed by the wait staff--- still a good place to try

Super chill spot for cocktails, shots, and tacos before a night out on the town. Wait staff was a little slow helping our large party at times, but didn't mind us walking up to the bar from time to time to add more drinks to our tab. Tacos looked amazing from what was on the table, however the ceviche was only OK and was more of a dip for chips than a dish.
Met up with some coworkers here for happy hour for Taco Tuesday! The service was so great, our waiters were incredibly attentive despite our loud and obnoxious group.
We came in at like 6:58pm on a Sunday and their happy hour ends at 7pm. The waiter was nice enough to let us order (0 to 100... Real quick)!!
Came here for Taco Tuesdays - tacos were OK (hard to please a San Diegan ;)), but you can have an unlimited amount of the carne and/or the veggie for $10 per person. Friendly, attentive service.
Cute loungey space. Wasn't too packed, so easy to find a table on a Thursday evening. We sat at the big communal table.
great space...the food looked amazing.
I loved this place!! Carnitas tacos are seriously a must try!! Best ever! And the ambiance is very chill :))

"Azucar" means "sugar" in Spanish (I can't believe I still remember this from high school Spanish..), and that sums up my experience here pretty well! I'd had Azucar Lounge bookmarked for ages, and I finally made the commitment to trek to the city on a Tuesday evening when my visiting SoCal friend mentioned she'd heard about this place's endless taco Tuesdays.

Went here for taco Tuesday with a group of people and had a blast! $10 unlimited tacos and carafes of margaritas. The tacos were pretty good considering they were unlimited, but I'm not sure if I got my money's worth. I could eat barely 4 tacos which is usually cheaper than $10 at most places, but the concept was cool! We ordered carafes of margaritas for the table - pretty good and a good deal for your money.
I was a bit worried when walking around the neighborhood, but when I walked into Azucar, I was like wow, cool place! This place is hip, decently fancy, and overall really "chill."
sweet hangout, but the food is not good.
Way fun place to hang out with friends, take a date for dinner and drinks.. whatever you wanna do, it's a great place to hang out and have a good time!
This place is SO GOOD! You definitely get value coming to Taco Tuesday here. They make their tacos fresh *it comes out warm and toasty* and the tacos go well with their $4 margaritas.
My friend and I were pointing out how random this place is with its Mexican theme, a sewing machine on one of the tables, an old school TV, and blasting 90s music haha.

Came here after work with some coworkers. It's not super close to our office (Embarcadero/Transbay Terminal area) but it was just a quick ride on the 14. It was busy but not as slammed as some of the places we normally go to. We arrived at 6 and I was worried we wouldn't get a table but the manager was very nice and sat us temporarily at a table that was being held for a reservation at 7, and then we moved when another table opened up.

This little lounge is an oasis on a busy Soma street corner... close to tons of bars and restaurants, but without the chaos that so many bars and restaurants breed. In my opinion, Azucar leaves absolutely nothing to be desired. The drinks are fabulous, the food is great and the atmosphere is just perfect for any occasion... I really can't say enough good things.

Went for a birthday brunch over the weekend and wound up with probably the worst service I have ever seen.  1. As the waiter was reading our orders back to us, he suddenly remembered the menu had changed and plantains would be replaced with kale (strange substitution and one that we should have been told beforehand).  2. $15 bottomless mimosas gave us each 3 mimosas. 3. We waited 45 minutes to get our food, two people in our group waiting over an hour. 4. Two meals were sent back. 5. One meal was too spicy for anyone to eat (note, we waited an hour for this meal). 6. One late arrival never had his order taken. We were told this was our fault for not telling a bus boy he needed to order. 7. We were told the bacon wasn't undercooked, it was delivered pre cooked and this is what it was white and slimy.  8.  When we asked to speak to a manager, we had to wait 20 minutes because he was also cooking the food.  He was very rude but ultimately comped our meals.
GREAT place. Wonderful drink selection at the bar. The food is awesome, Taco Tuesday is a must!!!
pretty sure the jalapeno beer gave me explosive diarrhea

The company came here for a Taco Tuesday/happy hour. The ambiance is nice, the staff is attentive and the food is great. Unfortunately (for me), the others in the group weren't looking for tacos, apparently every other person had dinner plans. I felt betrayed. :(

The wait here is just ridic. Like nothing I've ever seen. We arrived here at around 11am on a Sunday and the line was wrapped around the block. 1.5 long hours later we get seated at a table. I'm not against a little wait, but 1.5 hours for anything, especially breakfast, is just preposterous in my opinion.
First time eating here...I took friends from out of town at 10 on a thursday and though completely full we were seated quickly as there was no line at all.
Doesn't live up to the hype. The line is always ridiculous and the food just isn't that great. It's not bad, but it's nothing special either. Certainly not worth waiting in line for.
Come, come! The Dottie's experience is in full flight here.

Delicious, friendly, and accommodating. Worth the one hour wait. Tip: go solo or with two people and you'll get seated much quicker. Had the vegan hash (off menu), the provolone strata and a piece of the chili-cheddar cornbread. All were fantastic!

Went there around 11AM and the line was wrapped around the building! Neighborhood seems sketchy, had a few homeless ask for money while I was waiting in line. Waited in line for about 30-45 minutes but it was well worth it! Staff was very attentive, coming to our table frequently. Had 2 of " The Open Roads" believe it was roughly $15 each. But it came with two eggs, bacon, ham or sausage, home fries, and either 2 pancakes or one french toast split. The french toast was SO GOOD! Looking forward to going back just for the french toast. Asked one of the staff why it was so good and he was very informative about what type of bread they use (I believe he said it was milk based & thicker than regular french toast bread" Also they asked if we wanted our bacon "crispy" or "chewy" which I thought was quite interesting. I've never been to a restaurant that asked me how I wanted my bacon, but I saw that as a plus.
I don't usually Yelp, but I couldn't pass up the chance to rave about both food and service. Louise...stellar!

I spent a week in SF, looking for a good breakfast spot each morning. I tried Dottie's on my last morning in town, and I think I saved the best for last. I'll be back every time i'm in town from now on. There was a line out the door to get in not too long after they opened. The atmosphere was warm, the service was excellent, and the food was delicious. I had a 3 egg omelet with the cornbread and jalepeno jelly. My meal mates had french toast and over medium eggs, both with bacon, and both were equally impressed. Before I could drink more than half of my coffee someone was around to fill it up. Our waitress was cheerful and full of personality, which was delightful.

Best breakfast I've had in America. The frittata special was awesome, especially with a side of pico de gallo. My boyfriends scramble a perfectly soft cooked scramble. Staff were friendly and efficient. What more do you need! Waited about 20 mins for a table at 11am on a Thursday.

Blown away by the frittata, potatoes and jam. Arguably one of best breakfasts I ever had. But that is also like me just walking out of a movie theater after seeing Guardians of the Galaxy - a cool movie and saying it was the best ever, even better than Star Wars. Not true, but good conversation starter.

A friend of mine recently invited me to Sunday brunch at Dottie's True Blue Cafe in San Francisco, and I learned something: if there's a line snaking out the door of a restaurant, and you see that many of the people in the line have brought a book or an iPad to occupy themselves while they wait, then you're very likely in for a treat.   After all, these folks have been through the crazy line before, and found the food so good that they've chosen to spend a sizable chunk of their day in line to savor it once they're finally inside.  This time, they just came more prepared for the line.

Had a party of 6... so 3 couples. And they asked us if we could split in to 2 tables.. 3 and 3. ????? ... after waiting 45 min outside the door.. waited another 45. The guy did reiterate it would be a longer wait since he wanted to sit together. I guess understandable. Pepper jelly is really good. The rest of the food was mediocre. I would say not worth the wait. Should have gone to mama's. But the Waitress was nice.
This place wasn't at all bad, nor was it at all the hype it appears to be on Yelp. I didn't get to try the pastries though which seems to be a huge hit!

This place is a real gem. Showed up at 7:45 on a Monday(15 mins after doors opened) and it was packed already. Waited less than 20 minutes to be seated and were treated to a truly special breakfast. The kitchen is small (an open kitchen manned by no more than 3 people), but they work fast. Omelette was superb, the toast was among the best I've gad( I know it's toast okay, just trust me) and the pancakes were large and tasty. If you don't mind a short wait early in the morning, this is a spot not to be missed. Will have to return to try all the amazing looking baked goods on offer.

I've wanted to try this hyped up breakfast spot for a very long time. Sad to say I found nothing special about my experience. I found the dishes hearty & plentiful yet in dire need of some real flavor.

As I told my wife, "I won't forget about this breakfast". I don't often say that about breakfast food because I order the same thing all the time. But I decided to switch up my eggs and bacon and order the eggs & hotlinks. #EPIC. *i added a side of bacon

It's great down home hearty food with no pretense. The wait staff has always been great. The location gives a great street show. When they were on Jones, around the corner from Glide, you got the best entertainment waiting in line. It's like a breakfast show. My mouth waters when I look at the photos and I always want to get on BART and just go and have breakfast. MMMMM. If you are fussy about the street element, don't go. If you love good hearty SF inspired breakfast, GO. Yum. Take cash and make your life easier.

Came here on a Sunday morning for brunch. I ended up waiting for almost an hour in line, but it was worth it. There's a decent selection of pastries, egg dishes, pancakes, and sandwiches, and of which come in big portions.

All I can say is WOWOWOW! Almost didn't wait in line... 'cause I'm not a line person, at all. But something told us to stay and thank God we did because this place is an oasis in a very borderline neighborhood.  The food is spectacular!  Baked goods, eggs, world class coffees, happy staff! I want to move in to Dottie's! Can't wait to go back! :-)
Dottie's a diamond in the rough. While the neighborhood isn't that great, the food makes up for it. The Portions are huge, and everything I have tried on the menu has been fantastic.

I used to spend the night down the street occasionally and would wake up to the smell of pancakes and bacon cooking at Dottie's. It became my favorite breakfast place and years later it remains as good.

This place is fantastic. HUGE shout-out to Damon, our waiter who was insanely great! Talk about no B.S., in and out service and he had me laughing at the same time. On top of his excellent service, the food was as good as he promised. Word of advice, do not order the "Costco" English muffins and spring for the home-made dill bread. Delish!
The cons: The line. It's slow moving. They don't take cards, cash only.
Cheers to a DELISH experience! Damon was Amazing with his recommendations and his hospitality. The cornbread is a MUST  SINGING praises long after lunch!!!

This place is fucking ridiculous. I'm still waiting in line after standing out on 6th St for over an hour smelling piss and feces and having passersby holler at me but I stuck it out because I've heard good things. I am now at the front of the line (where I have been standing for the last 15 minutes) and I am staring at 5 empty tables and yet they are refusing to seat us. If I ever make it to the table and order food before I pass out from hunger, exhaustion, or the toxic fumes of 6th St, I will update and let you know if it was at all worth it.

The omelet was very flavorful this is the best omelet I have ever had to date. The house coffee was deliciously crafted and the thick bread was toasted to perfection. It is a large bounty for such a small price. Thank you for taking pride In your craft. This will be a place that I will return to and tell my friends about. I'm getting hungry again just from posting this

Ok but it's so overhyped it was a little bit of a let down. This time I tried the fried egg sandwich special with prosciutto and avocado and it was just way too salty. I couldn't even finish a quarter of the sandwich.  The husband had the Wild Boar sausage with eggs and he too didn't finish- the sausage was too rich.......

Like the many other Yelpers who came here, I was left full & satisfied! Be careful what time you come. I waited 25 minutes today for brunch before the Giants parade (which was a quick walk from the diner)

Pretty good breakfast/brunch joint. The line's usually pretty long,  so even if you go later in the morning, be prepared for around a 25-30 min wait. The smoked salmon omelette I ordered was very solid and the homemade buttermilk dill toast was excellent. Service was good even though they were busy and waitress filled our coffee at least 3 or 4 times.  Prices are relatively high but reasonable for the large portions

Going early a few Sunday's back; awesome service, made to order traditional breakfast with homemade bread. Given that it's in the heart of San Francisco, this one of the best deals on a City breakfast you'll ever find. The lines exist for a reason. Friendly, helpful waitstaff.
We landed in SF, dropped off our stuff, and walked straight over to Dottie's for lunch. Here are my thoughts:

I was waffling (no pun intended, HAHAHAHA) between 4 and 5 stars for Dottie's but I decided you know, this is the type of place I keep thinking about and wanting to figure out a way to return to, so it's probably a 5 star joint.

The best gluten-free pancakes around! Rice Flour Banana Raspberry Pancakes - nice and fluffy and perfectly cooked. The Whiskey Fennel Sausage Scramble was delicious. The portions are generous - so go with an appetite. Everything else about Dottie's is fabulous too - from the cool San Francisco vibe, the high ceilings and brick walls, the delicious generous portions and the friendly sassy service. The menu, the atmosphere, the patrons, the servers, the location, the decor - everything came together to create an authentic San Francisco experience.

Well this is supposed to be the best breakfast in San Francisco, at least according to the hotel doorman. He is so right. A bit of a wait to get in but what a breakfast. Started with a maple pecan scone. Very light and you could taste that it's homemade. Tip-sit at the bar as you get a great view of the kitchen staff and you can see they love their job. Very chatty with some of the staff too.

Came at 8 AM for Saturday brunch. Waited for  50 minutes and every second was worth to wait. I had zuccini cake poached eggs, hubby had the lamb sausage scramble. Both were so delish. Even side potatoes weren't overly grassy like most breakfast places. Muffins and even coffee was quality one.
I don't get the rave reviews. Food was decent but given the lineup and crappy service, I wouldn't come back!

Friday morning in the Mission District.  Not much has changed in the 40+ years since I worked down here. No parking, crazy traffic, dirty sidewalks, turn of the 20th century buildings, and a strange collection of people representing all of life's choices (some not so great). Same old, same old.
A real neat and special breakfast place that's worth a visit.
This place is awesome!

Nothing but pleasant things to say about the food at Dottie's. We ordered: the special Avocado, tomato, jalapeño, scallions, corn, and feta frittata; black bean cakes and eggs; and 1 banana raspberry rice flour pancake. The frittata came with potatoes and a bread side, we requested corn bread with jalapeño jelly which was an additional dollar. The cornbread and jalapeño jelly was delicious. The cornbread had chunks of jalapeño as did the jelly. It was the perfect balance of sweet and spicy. The banana raspberry pancake was moist, tasting similar to a cake. The black bean cakes were compressed black beans in a small patty with sour cream and pico de gallo on top. The black bean cakes and egg dish was served with eggs, two black bean patties, potatoes, and cornbread with jalapeño jelly. We felt each dish was large enough to share with two people. Once we placed our order the food was served hot and quickly. We gave this restaurant 5 stars. Our only complaint is the location as we walked to and from Dottie's we were approached by many aggressive panhandlers.
I don't really get the whole chicken and waffles thing. I grew up eating fried chicken from KFC, so it's always been chicken and biscuits for me. Mmmmm KFC biscuits...
I love this place! Already been here twice within a month and I am so addicted to their chicken.

I came here before a game. The food and atmosphere was great, but then again it was filled with Giants fans so of course the atmosphere was great. It's so laid back here and the folks are super nice! I ordered the Country Benedict and my husband got the Chicken and Waffles. I'm not a chicken and waffles person but I do like the two separately. The chicken was moist and crispy. The waffles were crispy as well. My plate was delicious, the pulled pork came with these yummy pickled tomatoes. My yolks were nice and perfectly runny. The biscuit was really buttery and tasty. We were  happy campers.
***Surprisingly Good Rendition of Chicken and Waffles***
Totally worth it! If you're in the area give it a try.  The skillet sandwich is awesome!
I ordered the Fried Chicken sandwich. It came with chips sprinkled with paprika(?).

Ordered biscuits and gravy. Biscuits were hard and hardly fresh, sausage gravy was thin and runny and didn't even soak into the bisquits, eggs weren't cooked to order unless over easy is broken yolks in fried eggs, and the amount of food for the price was outrageous.  $15 for something they can fit in a 4x4 box, left me hungry for more. Charging sit down prices when there is nowhere to sit unless it's later in the day and the bar is open. This was my first and will be my only time eating at this hole in the wall. I would have given it less than 1 star if possible.

I'm a bit confused why everyone insists on the takeout window here, because the inside seating is spacious and has a rustic polish. Maybe it's takeout only on weekdays? Regardless if you come here for the food or the ambience, Farmerbrown is a solid chicken and waffles restaurant-bar hybrid. I came for a Sunday brunch with two friends and although there was a bit of a wait to order food, there was an abundance of seating.
Food: B
There's a whole lot of hype for this place and it's well warranted for what you get.
They have a huge indoor seating area and bar!  The chicken is a little bit overpriced

This cute, take out window on Ritch st. teases your nose with scents of fresh waffles and hot fried chicken. It's hard to miss it once you turn into the little alley. SoMa workers loyally line up at lunch to get their fix, so get here early to beat the lunch rush.

Came here to satisfy my fried chicken craving... This place is no Ad Hoc but it will have to do until I go back to Napa. This place is more like a bar that serves food. You go to the counter to order and seating is open.

Ordered delivery from EAT24. The fried chicken was excellent! Nice light golden brown, not greasy or cooked in old grease, moist and flavorful! I am so psyched to be able to get really great fried chicken in my neighborhood AND I can have it delivered! Oh, and the mac and cheese side was awesome too! Keep these guys in business!

For the record, the sit-down portion of their restaurant opens at NOON, but the street-side ordering opens at 10:30. This was a bit confusing since the lady behind the counter kept telling people that the restaurant would open at 11:45am.
such classy fried chicken.

I came for the soul food and stayed for much more.  Very relaxing atmosphere! I came mid day Sunday,  the games were on (not too loud) and the food + drinks were just incredible.  It's hardly more expensive but more upscale than a boring sports bar.
The service is incompetent. Be quicker. Not everyone wants to chat. You should be thrilled you have a line but don't keep us waiting.

I often don't review places, but this one was really bad.  Not only did we have to wait over 70 minutes to get our food, when it came it was cold!  I tried to brush it off, but when I received my credit card bill that month, they had charged me twice. Not even on the same day, on two separate days. I only been here once!

Came here for dinner with some friends...I wasn't aware that it is primarily a bar. It is a pretty cool space as a bar to come and hang out with friends/coworkers. You order your food at a small counter/table pretty deep in the restaraunt/bar, and servers bring out the food to you.
Allegedly, this is the best fried chicken in San Francisco. But does it pass the KFC test, that is, does it actually taste better than the colonel's "original recipe"?

This place is literally a hole in the wall. I'm not a huge fan of chicken & waffles so I got the bacon waffle dog. MMM!! The waffles here are SO fresh, and the bacon wrapped sausage was juicy and flavorful. It's a bit of a challenge to eat, though. Someone told me to eat it like a hot dog, except the dish comes with two waffles (with pickles & sauce on top). I just ate it with a knife and fork. Well whatever you fancy.

I've been touring a lot of the fried chicken restaurants in the city lately, so I decided to give this place a try (having never been to any of the Farmerbrown places before). I arrived shortly after opening, only a few people in the place. I walked up to the counter to order, mentioned to the guy taking orders that I had never been there, and I asked him a question about the menu. He was pretty rude to me. I have no idea why; maybe he thought my questions was stupid or something, but it was just a question about two of the dishes. Anyway, I ended up ordering the breakfast sandwich on a biscuit with boneless fried chicken and eggs over easy. The food came out pretty quickly, but the order was completely wrong: on a waffle instead of a biscuit, eggs cooked well done, and the chicken had a bone in it. They managed to quickly swap the waffle for a biscuit, which in hind-sight was a mistake, because the biscuit was so dense that it felt like I was like eating a wet brick. I thought the goal was to make biscuits light and fluffy. Not this place. It was like a rock.
Nothing special. The country benedict was bland and the fried chicken tastes like KFC.

Had a serious craving for waffles and FLS is where I decided to satisfy it. The chicken part of the Chicken and Waffles was AMAZING (crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside). Sadly, the waffles were so hard I thought the roof of my mouth was going to bleed (the taste was good, it was the texture that failed me on this one). When I tried to cut the waffle with my fork it was so hard that the waffle flipped up in the air throwing syrup everywhere.
Sigh. Even though they've disappointed me in the past with the lack of a weekend veggie poboy, their breakfast sandwich on a biscuit has won me back over.

OK. What can I say.  I got really really excited about the menu. French fries with turkey hash and a fried egg?  So many elements of goodness, how could I dislike this. A little underwhelming in the spice department but makes up for it in the presentation department and the whimsical decor - not a fancy place though, feel free to dress down.
Authentic, cool atmosphere + good soul food. I got the burger, and it was perfectly cooked and garnished. Great place to chill out with some friends and get some good food and drinks.
Waffle is good. Chicken a little dry and somewhat flavorless.

I JUST got lunch from little skillet like half an hour ago. I ordered the pulled pork with grits and watermelon lemonade. The pulled pork and grits were so oily omg. I could not even finish my lunch and I can still feel my insides dying a little. The watermelon lemonade however is sooooo gooood! Since it is so close to my work I will probably be back to try other things.
Came in here with my girlfriend.  We were really excited to eat some southern food! Ordered the works which is the chicken and waffles along with the gumbo.

Didn't realize this place was next to Cento, which I visited recently! You order at a window and can sit outside on a loading dock or inside their Southern style very spacious bar. Ordered the two piece chicken with coleslaw and jalapeño corn muffin. The chicken was delicious, but the coleslaw was lacking dressing and the corn muffin was tiny&certainly not spicy. Should have gotten the waffles  and sat outside. It was a gorgeous day out!
I was dogsitting my friend's 2 dogs and needed to pick up some lunch without having to tie up the dogs to a meter in fear that someone will dognap them.

Skillet serves up a good fried chicken, juicy tender chicken. The only reason why I've not given 5 stars was because I've had better and the coleslaw tasted like onions on onions. Its in some alley way, but even so there was a line waiting; preorder online if you want to get take out, or else the queue isn't slow, so you'll be alright. If you're going in a hot day, be prepared to see numerous houseflies flocking about the entrance, but I guess its harmless if it isn't going to be on your food.

Their food is pretty good (not great), and they have a good selection of beers, but the service is incredibly slow. We waited 45 minutes for a 2 piece chicken and waffles with a side last time we were there. The person who ordered before us was clearly sick of the wait as well, and we watched him try to get a refund unsuccessfully (which is why we kept waiting) It's also really expensive. I know SF is pricey, but this borders on ridiculous.

I've never felt so cheated in my life. I'm from NC and this was the worse $20 I've spent on food. I'm a fatty cakes I love to eat good food. Don't get the sweet tea, lemonade, shrimp n grits or cupcakes. Thumbs and all hands are down. And there's a frown on my face right now. I want to get a complete REFUND!!!!!!!!!!!!! Such a disappointment. Should of went elsewhere.
Cute brunch place with no crazy brunch line at 10am on a weekend yes! Came here today after my bf was done with his workout at the nearby crossfit gym.

Sometimes I feel like being a fatty and today was one of those days. I was up early and walked all around downtown, running errands and getting in my 10K steps far before 11AM even hit. I had been wanting to try this place for awhile now since it was so close! It's tucked away, so unless you plan on going here, you'll probably walk right past it.
Food 4/5

If you're looking for chicken and waffles in the city, LOOK NO FURTHER. You will be very, very happy with what you get here. Don't confuse this place with the other Farmerbrown's by Market. If you're meeting friends here, make sure you clarify the address!
Excellent menu selection. I had 2 super tacos for under $8. Both were good and a good portion size. Get here early because the line quickly fills up with people.

My bf and I went here for dinner last night. It was around 9 pm but there were still several people waiting to be seated. Crazy on a Thursday night! I have been here a few times before but my man hasn't so I was excited to bring him here so he can try the food. The first thing he said walking - in was.. "Baby, it smells good in here". The hostess said there's a 35 minute wait but we didn't mind. We sat inside as we watch people coming in to the restaurant. People keep coming and it is passed 9:15! We both loved it since it gave him an impression that the food will be good. We got seated after 25 minutes. We started with the Platanos Fritos: Sweet, fried plantains, black beans, Mexican crema. They came up so warm and well cooked. So soft that it melts your mouth. The black beans were cooked so well; it didn't tasted bitter at all.
Fantastic margaritas, great street tacos, enthusiastic staff, good happy hour deals. Enough said.

This place is great for lunch or dinner depending on what you are looking for.  I go here at least once a month for lunch and get their super burrito which is delicious.  They also have free chips and salsa as well as a salsa bar with a wide assortment to choose from.  Any Mexican restaurant that has a wide variety of salsas I usually find myself happy with.  Their orange sauce is awesome and I definitely recommend it.

One of the best Happy Hour deals in the South of Market/ Convention Center area of San Francisco. But you have to hurry because the place fills up as soon as 4pm hits. The quesadillas with chicken or steak and the nachos with chicken or steak are the best deals from 5-8 bucks. You can't go wrong! That alongside with affordable margaritas and well drinks during Happy Hour, plus a buzzy crowd makes Tropisueno your best option before a movie at the Century Theatre or the AMC nearby or a meeting convention center or just hanging out with friends when needing an affordable option. I highly recommend this place, not necessarily remarkable but always affordable.

I've seen so many of my friends ' reviews of this place and passed by it numerous times.  I thought it was more of a traditional restaurant setting because it looked like it was everytime I'd pass by it, plus since they take reservations in the evening.  So, I chose to meet my aunt there for a lunch break.

Came here early with a group of work friends. When we arrived we were pretty rudely told that we would need to get up at 7 for a reservation already in place. Completely understand the reservation thing but it was such a turnoff the way they approached the situation.

i was with my friends in happy hour on thurday and the waiter that  we got  was a little one nasty we ask  him if he could pick up the curtain because we want see out side he said not for a rule of the restaurant after two rounds of drinks we pay the bill and in less that  five minutes this man came and told us we have to leave the  table to other costumer. i think that was very ignorant.
I have been here a few times now and it is amazing every time. Margaritas are great and the food is even better. They also give you chips and a trio of salsa. This is one of my favorite restaurants.

This place is incredible. My boyfriend and I came here for the first time on Saturday afternoon. The line wasn't too long, and the food was brought to our table in less than 10 minutes. We each got a combination plate with 2 items (they come with rice and beans, too) and holy guacamole the portions are HUGE. Had we known, we wouldn't have ordered so much! It was great, though. There are tons of salsa options. It was a little too chilly to sit outdoors, but the inside tables were still nice. Inexpensive. Margaritas are yummy. 5 stars!

Great service and ambiance but I wasn't 100% happy with my meal here. My mom and I got the guacamole and chips and four soft tacos. The guacamole was delicious and the portion was generous. They also had a great salsa bar with a variety of salsas to choose from. I thought it was nice they included a section in the salsa bar for extra cilantro and radishes. The downside of my experience here however was the tacos. The meat was well seasoned but nothing amazing. The tortilla was really hard and not steamed properly. I'm thinking this isn't a normal thing for them -- I probably caught them at a bad time. Will come back to try again.

Came here for lunch and had the enchilada plate.  I got one steak and one chicken.  Everything had great flavor.  I usually don't eat beans but the refried had a good taste. The rice had a good kick.  In all the whole plate made me appreciate the whole meal more. Lunch is served fast causal style.  You order then get a number to wait for your food to be brought. I think dinner time is more of a sit down affair. The line is long but moves fast. The tables turn over quickly too during lunch. I will be back.
Food is Awesome... worth the wait (there was a long queue when we went.) The salsa bar with atleast 8 - 10 types was my favorite part, and they served fresh chips to go with that.
The decor is enough to step foot inside the building! It has sort of a Mediterranean feel to it, but almost Havana-like, which I guess would be Casablanca-esque.
Happy Hour Report:
They use queso on some dishes, without noting it on the menu, so watch out if you're pregnant...

A popular place recommended by lots of different sources including locals.  In town for a conference, and craving good Cali Mexican food (coming from Hawaii).  Service was good and at expectation.  Ambiance was busy and loud, but it was a Saturday dinner at 7:30pm.  Food was uncomplicated, straight forward, and flavorful.  Had the carne asado taco and chicken enchilada combo, friends got the hanger steak dish (forgot the name sorry).  All around very satisfied with our Cali Mexican food fix.  Bonus: it was right out the door from the Marriott Marquis where we stayed.
I've been here many times covering all times of the day from breakfast to lunch to happy hour to dinner!

Had the most amazing pollo asado tacos there. They were perfectly seasoned and the chicken was so tender. Some of the best chicken tacos I've ever had. Their salsa sampler that comes before the meal was also a nice treat, delicious!

I love this place. Good prices, large portions, authentic fresh food that is so flavorful and cute inside! The flauta was my favorite and made with corn tortilla instead of flour like most places make.

This place was good. Really good. We came here with a group of six for my brother's  bday, and boy oh boy this place delivered. Fantastic ambience, great server who helped my dad and stepmom find more "American" Mexican dishes (I.e, quesadillas, lol). But really the food here is fantastic! Loved their guacamole, salsas, habanero mango margarita (the waiter was worried I didn't like it because I had to take breaks to enjoy the spiciness level but it was really tasty). I definitely will be back for a date night with my husband :)
Solid spot for some good tacos for lunch or dinner. Make reservations for groups as it is fairly popular. Chicken mole was yummy!

Last night was my birthday, so my husband decided to take me to dinner anywhere I wanted.  We are new to the east bay, so we asked one of our new friends where a good spot for great Mexican food.  He told us the best place to go was to head into the city and trying Tropisueno.  My google map said it was only 20 minutes away, plus it was still pretty early, so we figured "why not?!"

Came for a quick night snack with a couple of friends. I tried the beef tacos and they were amazing. Very tasty. My friends got the different ceviche plates and they were all good. Would get 5 stars but the hostess was a little rude and unwelcoming, so they lose a star for that. Otherwise would come here again most definitely.
Enjoyed our late night meal on a Wednesday after the Giants' World Series Win. The best item is the chicken soup. To die for! And it's huge! Not to mention the rice and pinto beans, just heavenly.
Dinner for two at 10:45PM after a world series game.  A nice walk from AT+T park (.9 mi) on the way back to Marriot Marquis (Moscone area).

I wasn't expecting much from this restaurant - after all, we're not in the Mission but I'm a fan. It's a beautiful, spacious restaurant that serves HUGE portions at affordable prices. Their salsa's and Margarita's are amazing. Friendly staff too.

We arrived at around 4pm on a Saturday and it was kind of chaotic. It was not clear where to go and who was in charge. Once we figured out that you order at the window we took a seat in the bar (not at the bar). It took sometime to realize that no one was going to take a drink order, so we walked up to the bar to order. The restaurant opens at 5:30pm, and it was then that our table in the bar started to get regular service. Once we figured out how it all worked, we really enjoyed ourselves. The food was very tasty. I would definitely go back.

Best Mexican food. Mole is outstanding. Tortillas are home made. Chips and three kinds of salsa are great.  Chips are thin and after the three requisite bowls I am not stuffed. A gem and you need to come here but reservations are a good idea. Final tip. Try margarita with mango and jalapeño. You'll need at least two. Really.... Go here.

This place is great for workday lunches.  There's always a line, but it moves pretty fast.  The food here is always rich flavorful and delicious.  My favorite is the Tropisueno Torta, which is a sandwich with three kinds of meats on it.  They have bowls of chips and a salsa bar with several varieties.  There is plenty of seating indoors and out.

My boyfriend and I made reservations here while visiting from Philly, in town for the Nike Women's Marathon. We came based on the other reviews and the closeness to our hotel. The décor and ambiance of the place was so great! I loved the lighting and the feel of the place. It didn't feel chainey or like it was trying too hard. I'm a vegan and they had a tofu dish on the menu but I asked the waiter if they could accommodate me by making the enchiladas without cream or cheese and with veggies.. It wasn't an issue and they were delicious. The salsas were tasty and the portions were hefty. My boyfriend enjoyed his meal as well. Our bill was about $30 for the two of us... It was a steal! I wish I could have taken my left overs but our hotel didn't have a fridge! Great eats in San Fran :)

There's not too many medium-high end Mexican places in SF, but this place is pretty solid. I wish they had more veggie items though. I haven't tried any of the meat products there but they sound fantastic. Their ceviches are really good. Service is prompt and with a smile, even when the place is slammed. The drinks are really good too. The salsas that come with the chips are great, I like how there's 3 different kinds of different textures and flavor profiles.

I was brought here recently with some workmates. I am usually skeptical of Mexican food outside of the mission, but my expectations were by far exceeded here. Tropisueño is a beautiful Mexican place that manages to combine affordability, decent ambiance, and very good food. Good rice and beans. Meat is tasty and of good quality.
To sum it up:
Always here at lunch. Great shrimp burritos...guac and tacos.

Portions are plenty and quality is pretty good. I got the chicken quesadilla. I could not finish it myself. They have a salsa bar so go crazy. The waiters who bring your food (you order at the counter) are really hard working and accommodating. Tip them!
Great margaritas!!!!

Always love this place whether it be for lunch, happy hour, or dinner.  I've had the tacos for lunch/happy hour, mango ceviche & enchiladas for dinner.  The spicy mango margarita is amazing, reminds me of those mexican lolly pop candies!

This place is great for happy hour!  Margaritas are $6.50, tacos are $2.50, Fernet shots are $3 (unheard of!).  The portions are very generous and chips and salsa are free!  It's hard these days to find free chips and salsa in the Bay area.
Got the pollo asado. Chicken was tender, and the sides on the plate were pretty good. Could've  used more veggies, but I usually think that for everything.
This place was THEEEEEEEE BEST! Ivan is an amazing bar tender!!!!!!!!!!!!! Great time. And all of the food is so delicious.

This place is awesome. It reminds me of a very special place in my heart: Vegas. Haha have you ever been to a Lavo champagne brunch? Well, if you haven't, this place is pretty similar sans the half naked people in slutty outfits and huge crowd.

This is probably one of the few bars in the area that is not packed post work on a weekday.  I came in around 6:00pm or so and there were plenty of stools to sit on.  They have a limited amount of tap brews to get and a lot of bottles on site.  Most of them veer towards the Belgian/White Ale sort of thing with a few IPA thrown in.  The food is what I was digging.  I tried the chicken tacos and even though the tortilla was super small, the filling itself was great!  The mini tortilla barely could hold all of that together.  Also had the parmesan truffle fries when I got my 2nd beer.  It was a good pairing with the beer and it wasn't a small amount either, perfectly suited to be shared for two people.
It's a little confusing whether this place is The Pink Elephant or Alibi.  Either way I'd say its important to note with friends when meeting up!
Went here for brunch this last weekend for their self serve bottomless mimosa bar.
Place was lively in sat at noon! Only gripe was they kept asking to clear plates and Bill came before we asked!
Showed up late in the evening because Dave's was packed and I was looking for a bar that served snacks. Overall, this place is alright, but nothing impressed me.

Lots of beer selections, especially Belgium.  Pretty cool place but I feel like the tables could be a lot cleaner.  Otherwise, the happy hour menu is not bad. $5-6 wines and well drinks.  Lots of seating. Appetizers and fingers food is alright but pricey is a bit steep.
Brunch review only!

Holy moly! Self serve mimosa bar with 20 flavors is enough for the 5 stars. Luckily we had a Groupon $25 for $50 worth of food! The smoked salmon Benedict on the biscuit was delicious even though it didn't need to be!

This place was SO. STUPIDLY. LOUD. It's set up as a pretty regular-looking place, with lots of tall tables and a long bar, with TVs above the bar - but the music was annoying-bro-club loud. The focus is Belgian beer, but the food is all Latin, and they were playing some crazy loud Enrique Iglesias. It all seemed like an odd confluence of styles. Our plantains with black bean puree were very yummy, but the guacamole and salsa fell flat. The beer selection looked interesting, but we couldn't agree and settled for a vodka tonic, which was tolerable but weak.
Great food, and server, but the DJ train wreck and mindless sound volume ruins the party scene for Saturday brunch.
On a week day Pink Elephant:
Great place to have a good time and enjoy delicious food and cocktails. They now offering entertainment every Friday night I will check it out this week and see what is like!!!

I came in here thinking this would be an awesome place to catch the games on Sunday and grab mimosas...definitely not the business. Food was average at best and mimosas were whatevers...they have a bucket that has Nasty spoons that you use pour mixers with your overpriced "Andre" champagne. Music was whatevers for the most part...live DJ but he was definitely average at best. I think what ticked me off the most was the fact that a bar like this does not subscribe to a proper cable/dish service and I was forced to watch the game on my phone...almost seemed like they were using dial up to stream games on the tv and fairly embarrassing to watch the dude behind the bar struggle to load the games. Overall, pretty whack experience...probably won't go back

Went there on a friday, it was decent. There are no mimosas that day but there is  a lot of beer to choice from. I got the quesadilla, it was good. Not something out of this world. The service is what was weird about this place. I kept having to try and get their attention to pour me water, they are really inattentive about that, despite the fact that there weren't many people there. They have big screens at the bar so this place would be a good place to watch games. I was not super amused though.

Stumbled upon this place with a peer in a big conference week in the city. The atmosphere is great with the best selection on beers in town specially Belgian beers. The service amazing though a packed place with the SF Giants playoff game on TV. Must go place hidden near Moscone.

An interesting location with cool decor and fun music for Saturday brunch. The eggs Benedict are fantastic, though the hollandaise is a bit salty. Great home fries with feta! Juice bar is awesome, with dozens of options. Sassy bacon is to die for. Good service also!

The Pink Elephant is like brunch club madness. You've got self-serve bottomless mimosas in a bunch of different flavors with good tunes blasting at you from the DJ booth. All of that is great, if you're in the mood for it, but be warned that it's really loud in there, so if you're with a big group, you're not going to be able to talk to most of the people you're with without shouting (and even then, they probably won't be able to hear you, as my group quickly learned). But moving on...

I never write a review, and it so happens that the one or two times that I do write a review, it is on a place that was extremely disappointing.  I have been here once in August prior to my horrible experience.  I went here with some friends and already did not have a great impression of this place but decided to come again.

I'm here to watch game 6 of the World Series their TV is connected to the Internet and the connection sucks!! Service sucks as well. Half hour to get my drink order and had to follow up. If not, I don't think I'll get it. Truffle fries I had to pick up myself from the table by the kitchen. By the time it reached my table it's already cold. Being from the hotel and restaurant industry this establishment needs to work very hard to make it.

Alibi is a great spot to hang out and enjoy some beer and grub.  They have a huge selection imported German beers and on Wednesday, they usually feature one of those beers.  They have some cool mugs too for some of those beers.  Really its a good beer spot.

Such an awesome hidden spot!! Their brunch is amazing! They have bottomless mimosas with so many different flavors - its a pour-it-yourself set up so you can pick whatever flavor you want. They food is also amazing! I got a duck benedict and it was phenomenal! Highly recommend if you can find it! :)

Chilled with a couple of the bartenders who were great. Awesome music and atmosphere. Upbeat but not douchie or ghetto. Drinks were good - only had the fries which were bangin. Overall great experience.

Nope nope nope. If you look like you just walked out of an Old Navy ad and you don't mind bros hitting on you, this is your joint. There is no character here and the food isn't worth the atmosphere. Super douchetastic. The servers were nice but there may not be a hostess? We just stood there until the bar took pity on us and got us help. The French toast is tasty, the burger wasn't good, the eggs benny also not great. The menu is limited, and not in a fancy way, and there is no coffee... AT A BRUNCH JOINT.

If you can overlook what can only be described as a spring break dance party for tech workers, the MR beef burger for him and bottomless mimosa bar for her make this place a real contender for my SF brunch dollars.

Really awesome place to hang. I'm not a drinker, I admit, but I'm always looking for the perfect place to hang and chill with friends after a hard day. This place was entirely SF in its flavor and a great place to catch up with good company.
good place,  good people, good food. what else can you ask for? It's my go-to place to  socialize with buddies on the weekend

Maybe I'm just getting old, but 6 friends of mine and I strolled in here for brunch on a Sunday morning and thought the in-house DJ blasting hits at 11am was a bit much. Maybe it's because we were hungover from the night before...

First time coming to The Pink Elephant after hearing from friends how great this place was but after coming here, I'd only come back for a night event. We went here for brunch on a Sunday morning; there's an in house DJ playing music while you eat your food, drink, and watch Sunday football.

Brunch review - For all those recommendations on the sassy bacon, DELETE THOSE COMMENTS.  The sassy bacon was the biggest disappointment I've had in food eating history.  When someone tells you they're serving you bacon, you expect some delicious ass bacon because, of course bacon is delicious by itself.  What is the sassy bacon? The sassy bacon is PORK JERKY, sweet teriyaki PORK JERKY.  So if you want a cold dry sweet spicy piece of pork jerky feel free order the shit outa it.  If you had in your head that you wanted some delicious hot salty greasy bacon, then prepared to be let down..........................Eggs benny was aight and thats all folks

An excellent happy hour spot in FiDi! It is one of the few places in the city that plays ratch hip hop - a bar after my own heart (: I came at 5:30PM on a Friday and it was pretty packed but my party of 5 was still able to get a standing table pretty easily.
Could be better service. People don't have all day to be here during lunch. Slow service and not attentive to update the patrons on changes.

The Pink Elephant's located down a weird alley. This adds to the uniqueness of this place. The place has some very interesting paintings and a very very nice looking bar. There's a few TVs in this place that they played some sports game on.

They have a full menu on weekdays for lunch and dinner, but only serve brunch on weekends. Even so, the brunch menu is quite decent, with a selection of omelette, eggs benedict, french toast, and a variety of burgers.
The food was decent and the beer selection was good, but the place reeked of auto fumes and ran uncomfortably hot.

Crystal is one of the managers here and she rocks!  She took a shot of Fernet with me and is super cool.  Ivan is super awesome too.  I like to buy shots for people who will take them with me and they were down so this place gets 5 stars immediately!  Good food too!  Truffle fries.... Get this, free bacon during happy hour!! Whaaaat!?!?  Go here, nuff said.

Came here for my brother's birthday, great music[thanks to the live DJ], delicious craft beer, and affordable drunchies. The lights are dim and the evironment is ecstatic. Restrooms are clean and most of all the staff is extremely friendly, the waitress checked in every now and then to make sure we were good. I have to say this is the best experience I have ever had at a gastropub and I definitely recommend taking a visit. Definitely coming back **

Meh. The brunch is good, especially the potatoes, but the portions are small and you'l likely leave still hungry.  I've heard good stuff about their happy hour though so...I'll be back (in Arnold's voice).

Don't usually leave reviews but this place deserves it! Staff is way beyond friendly, they also have a wide selection of beers to choose from, their "Sassy bacon" is mouthwatering. Overall, a very chill place to grab a couple of drinks and hang with friends or down a boot of beer! Haha

I asked what the special pastel was and it sounded delicious. I waited 20 minutes for a to go order and it ended up being wrong. I got ham and cheese. I was so hungry and crunched for time I ate them both and left. The acai looks great but in not sure I'll be back.
An authentic, casual piece of Brazil right next to Portrero Hill!  Feijoada was yummy.

Pastel Do Brazil is a true gem in Potrero Hill. Their acai bowl is delicious and very refreshing on a warm day. The acai fruit blend is thick and creamy, not watery at all. Topped with sweet, nutty and crunchy granola and fresh banana slices, this fruit bowl makes the perfect breakfast or post-workout snack.
Best post-workout food around. Conveniently located in World Gym. The owner is super nice too!
Tried their acai bowl and my friend had the Ronaldo's breakfast (i think). Idk what kind of bread they served with the Ronaldo's but it was goooood

This is a great place for those from Brazil to enjoy some home cooked food like some of us... Pastel is delicious. I tried all of them. The salgadinhos are also great especially coxinha. But the best is Feijoada. The best in SF. Perfect on a Saturday. The place is by World's Gym so it serves some healthy stuff too. Great freshly squeezed juices. The good looking people going in and out of the gym is icing on the cake. The owner/cook is so friendly. Actually all the staff there. Anyway, you can't go wrong here. JUST GO!

I like the Owner of Pastel Brazil who rumbling he is.. I came here with my two teenager boys so they can experience the Brazilian food and Both of my sons eat their food so quickly that I had to order a second
This place is a little gem. I went specifically for a pastel, but came too late in the afternoon, because they were already sold out for the day.

Wow! I'm really impressed by this place. The food is great and the prices are cheap! After trying fogo de chao, I discovered my love for brazilian cheese rolls. I came here after a doctor's appointment randomly because I was in the area and I'm glad I did. Unfortunately, cheese rolls were all sold out but I tried the pastel (fried meat pastry) with ground beef and cheese. It was fried fresh and was sooo good. The breading tasted almost like a big, thick wonton skin and the filling had warm cheese, corn, and ground beef. Delish!
Great service, Alemao and his wife are super friendly and always greet you with a smile.

I am a regular at this place because of the neighboring gym.  The smoothies are a near- daily thing for me, and ready specially for me when I walk out the door.  On the occasions I've tried the food, I have always been pleased.
Love this place. Quick, cheap, healthy meals after a workout, or breakfast in the mornings. I eat here about 3 times / week. Delicious - highly recommended!!

Tão delicioso!  Tha's how you say "Its sooooo delicious!" in Portuguese!  Pastel Do Brazil does NOT disappoint.  This is a gem of a place which is conspicuously situated in front of World Gym.  The food is AMAZING!  During my past visits, I have had their steak wrap (get your own, you will NOT want to share!), their grilled chicken platter which is generously served with tender moist chicken and Wides' amazing pumpkin/okra mash (which is crack in itself - I need to order a super side order of this next time with everything else!), their pasteles are addictive and worth every bite - and you MUST try their special pasteles!  On one occasion, Wides made a "special" dish for me and needless to say, I engulfed it within 10 minutes before thanking him.  Their smoothies are delicious and fresh and all natural.  The next time I visit though I will have to try their Acai Bowl.  Its always staring at me but yet I'm so full of their delicious treats that I never have enough time.  Wides and Raul are an amazing father/son duo who keep the kitchen and stoves running while keeping their customers engaged, happy and bellies full.  It's a definite favorite go to place.  Check it out!
Omg... I can't  believe I've had missed this place . I work around this place every day and only today I gave it a try. I really like the plate  I ordered. A huge plate of brazilian homemade dishes..
This is the best cafe in SF. Healthy smoothies with real fruit, breakfast sandwiches, salmon for dinner.. and staff is so friendly and low key.

This place being inside the gym saves me multiple times a week. Their pink protein. Steak and rice or chicken and veggies with maduros are my go-to's. If you live or work around and don't frequent this place, you're doing something wrong.
