100% Authentic Brazilian snacks. Owner is super friendly and helpful. Makes his pastéis right on the spot. Very humble and quaint little restaurant. It's a family owned business too, he's got his sons working with him. Went there today to celebrate our victory 4-1 Brasil vs Cameroon after the game. Was more than pleased. The portions are great. The açaí is amazing and so is their pastel (parece pastel de feira mesmo!!!!). Will definately be back for more. There's also a special everyday on the menu and if i remember correctly he told me saturdays there's Feijoada. A comida é um delícia aqui!!! Se você for brasileiro/a dá uma conferida, com certeza mata um pouco da saudade do Brasil!!

It's a hidden gem. Didn't realize it was there until I joined World Gym. Great food, very tasty, fresh, and healthy. I had both the chicken and steak wraps; not only they were delicious, they serve a generous amount.

I have to give this place five stars! The entire dining experience took me right back to Brazil. My favorite food while studying in Brazil was the pão de queijo, of course, and rice and beans.  They nailed it! If you ever have a hankering for Brazilian food, be sure to give this place a try! I can never recapture the spirit and beauty of Brazil , but this place brings back the fond memories of my time there!

Was so excited to have lunch today.  I walked in and saw they had a salmon lunch special platter.  I ordered it to go. When I opened my lunch the salmon was cooked to death!  Dry as a cardboard and flavorless.  The rice and beans was great but again the salmon was far to be desired. Oh ya it was $13.00 and overpriced!!  Don't get the salmon!

Amazing pastel!!! You can order a delicious soda from Brazil, Guarana, and have a cheese pastel. The staff is really friendly, they prepare other kinds of pastel and tipical brazilians food!!! I recommend this place to all!!!
Great açaí the best healthy and refreshing choice on this crazy hot day!!! But I couldn't resist and order some delicious pastel
Super bomb chicken wraps and priced very well. Guys are friendly and the food is clean. Eat here
Hidden gem! It's randomly tucked inside the world gym but the location totally works in its favor. Hilarious random jacked dudes plus simple delicious Brazilian food makes for a fun lunch.
Best food in Potrero Hill. Healthy and tasty !!!
recommend this restaurant, they have the best food and also Brazilian acai, will prove the best Brazilian food.

I am so excited to have discovered this place so near my office. There is such an authentic and welcoming vibe. A lot of Brazilians hang out here and the lady and gentleman behind the counter are always joking around and all smiles. The food is great - they can make pretty much anything you want, even if it's not on the menu. Every time I go they give the food a special touch and it is amazing.
I love Brazilian food so much that I can speak enough Portuguese to order a meal. The owner of this fine establishment even complimented by pronunciation and asked if I was Brazilian!! Score!!
The best Brazilian pastel outside Brazil!
I love this place cause i lov my job.my costumers and i love who comes every day end always bring me a new friend .so my name is wides vital da silva i am pastel brazzuca  owner .thanks everybody
When I'm craving for a Brazilian goodies I come  to Pastel Brazil!
The food is great and very authentic! Everyone who works there and the people that visit are friendly and have formed a community. I love it :)

I have nothing but good things to say about Pastel.  I first discovered it when I started working out at World Gym, where it is located and I have been hooked ever since.  It is healthy Brazilian food at very reasonable prices; perfect for post-workout meals.  I even introduced my friend from Brazil to this place and he loves it and continues to come back.  He says the Pastels are just like what you would find in Brazil and they are phenomenal.  It doesn't hurt the the owner Wides is the nicest guy ever, and that goes for the other employees as well. It's always a good day when I get to eat at Pastel. And, if you want a dose of Brazilian culture, look no further; Pastel is frequented by lots of Brazilians and you may even learn how to speak Portuguese. It's an awesome place and I would recommend it to eveyrone!
The best Brazilian food in the Bay Area. Their fresh juice is delicious. You gotta try their platter special with steak, rice, bean and a salad.
The best smoothies, shakes, pastries, plus Brazilian food of the most delicious stile, fresh made everyday, personalized in front of you. Something that just a family business can bring to your diet!
I'm here a few days a week after working out at the gym next door.  They are superfast, and make a variety of healthy and great tasting meals and shakes.  Happy this place is here!
I just hoped in early today after passing this Brazilian place several times. I ordered a Bagel Melt Egg for breakfast and must say this is pretty good.

I've been a member of World Gym for quite a while now, and it wasn't until recently that I decided to try my taste buds here. All I can really say is... WOW. Not only is the food AUTHENTIC BRAZILIAN, and not to mention AMAZING, but this place offers a variety of choices for you to enjoy. I can say without a doubt that every dish in their menu is not only well prepped, but the ambiance and the QUALITY SERVICE that the staff provides makes my trip here always enjoyable.

Awesome! I didn't eat here but just by looking at the food, the menu and the prices, I can tell I want to and I will.  I had a papaya smoothie and a hard-boiled egg. Next time I may order rice with steamed veggies and an egg on top. Yum.
Yummy Pink Protein smoothie, but the meat in the wrap I had was indistinguishable...kinda scary!
Best spot to stop for a pre-game drink and sandwich!  The prices are better than anything in the neighborhood and so is the food!
Waaaaay overdue review.
Great place for lunch. Food is pretty good and everyone is friendly.
Good value and also has a nice selection of books and magazines (to buy). The little garden is very pretty and seems family/dog friendly.

My favourite coffee shop in San Francisco and possibly ever. The staff are the greatest, the food is freshly prepared or baked on site and the prices cannot be beaten. On top of all of that the Delancey St. Foundation is doing amazing things for what seems like amazing people. Ice cream scoops are massive, coffee refills are free, indoor and outdoor seating and even beer and wine.  We are lucky to live in the same neighbourhood.
Cheap eats. Love this place. Ambience is very relaxing. No Wifi BUT there are books/magazines around that you can read. It's a quiet place so you can get a lot of things done. Friendly service.

Apple tea slice is to die for.This place is a unique joint with books coffee desserts to dive in.I have also tried and loved the berry smoothie.This place is amazing for dessert and drink lovers.Desserts dont seem to rotate or change often though.

Atmosphere: Order at the front, bring a number to your table, food is delivered, and when you're done, plates can be left on the tables (or brought to a nearby basin next to the trash can). Great for studying or chatting with friends. Seating is  mismatched and haphazard which works for 1 person or as many as 6 (with 4 being ideal) as it includes benches, small/large tables and sofas with coffee tables.
Fantastic gem in SoMa. Delicious sandwiches. Great atmosphere and outdoor seating. This place is my little secret.

Favorite SF place, ever! Food is delicious, prices are amazingly reasonable - no where better in SF for that, for sure - staff is AWESOME, and to add to all that, they have both a lovely outside garden area that is big, full of trees and flowers, and peaceful. Oh, and my other favorite attribute is the bookstore and cool gift area. I usually have b'fast or lunch, tea, and buy books and gifts all in one fell swoop. Lastly, parking is usually available right outside. Can you think of any other place in SF that has all this?
Unforgettable pie.
Great cute spot with good atmosphere! Very friendly service and good food! I didn't give 5 stars because of 1 register, 2 persons on kitchen and huge line on Sunday morning!

Best damn tuna melt of my life. The tuna was fresh and the sandwich itself was perfectly grilled. Four stars because of the slow service. I waited a long time for my food and it was mostly empty in there.

So the menu on this page isnt correct with their actual menu so I was bit disappointed when I walked in and they didnt have some stuff. This place gets really busy at lunch but over all pretty good. Sometimes the service isnt that good and the people behind the counter are playing around and dont notice your waiting to be helped.
Had a bagel with lox and it was amazing! Great outdoor patio. Would definitely recommend!
Great hidden gem. Perfect lunch place, coffee, and desserts! Great prices with gorgeous garden seating!

The whole place is cool i would definitely be back here. It has a whole outside seating area thats very relaxing. You can eat and read at the same damn time. The inside is like a coffee shop/ library.
Very nice and affordable place, great for breakfast and lunch!
This place is on my way to work and I love it for a few reasons:

My go to place after appointments and city activities. Since I have had the pleasure of the delicious meals as a disabled individual the staff goes out of their way to be genuine and warm. Delicious salmon crapes, great grilled sandwiches, and interesting platters. My favorite is the chocolate cake made from scratch!
Very disappointed. Poor service, poor food, and 30 minute wait during off-peak hours.

Really nice little discovery.  Was introduced to this place by a friend who works near-by.  Plenty of metered parking right in front for a Friday lunch (on a non-game day!).  Got there early, so I spent some time browsing their small (but well stocked) bookstore.

I guess I'll have to come back here some day to try some more things on their menu, but I grabbed a small bite when I was here to meet someone and didn't think it was all that spectacular. I can see the appeal of it as a place to just sit, read, and sip on coffee or nimble on some food, though. It certainly has a large enough space for you to chill alone or with a group.
They have super cheap good coffee,
Great service, good food, and excellent prices, what more can I say? Oh location can't be beat either. Nice place to have lunch and support rehabilitation! Will definitely be back!
Wow, I was really pleasantly surprised at the great service and better yet great food here!
what a slice of heaven in busy San Francisco!
Nice place with good and affordable coffee and breakfast.
A surprising delight whilst walking down the street aimlessly for a decent joint to eat at on a Sunday afternoon, awesome!
I come here often for lunch, as my work is right next to Crossroads. I get two crepes, which is something I'm working on cutting down. But the spinach and cheese crepe is on point.

By far my favorite daily cafe and not just because it's nearby. Been coming here regularly for over 8 years now. Great setting (outdoor garden area, variety of seating options inside). Great service (most food is brought over to your table). Diverse menu (crepes, Mitchell's ice cream, wine & cheese, etc.). If asked there isn't much I'd ask them to improve on.
This is a great spot for a quick lunch or early dinner. The salads are fresh and filling. I find that the staff is friendly and helpful. The patio is really comfortable on a warm day.

I have to say, this place was one of my best experiences ever in San Francisco and given the circumstances of my day, it could have easily ended up being my worst.  After purchashing some used furniture nearby, my son and I decided to stop in here for a late lunch. We just happened upon it accidentally because we were looking for a place to park, assuming we would have to walk a ways to eat somewhere. There were plenty of open, pay parking spots right in front and a number of cute shops nearby.
Great food! Tasty drinks! Awesome service! Great location! Relaxing environment. This place is a rare gem in the SoMa, and you won't find anything like it around.
I adore this place so much. It is part bookstore, coffee shop, cafe, and garden. Love the tables all throughout - unlike most bookstores that make sure to keep dining area separate.

Wandered over with some coworkers to grab a healthy lunch.  Great selection of options to suit most people - healthy and not so healthy.  Sandwiches, paninis, salads, crepes (sweet and savory), small plates, etc.  Not to mention they've got beer, wine, ice cream and coffee.

A cozy place with beautiful patio and an interesting small store. Child-friendly. Fair prices and delicious ice creams and milkshakes. No free wi-fi and my mobile wi-fi didn't work well there, but sometimes it's not so bad to be internet free.

I know some people who go to crossroads constantly. I really don't understand it. The food is average at best. The venue is kind of nifty the first time you go, but wore on me very quickly. The service can be slow as well. This place is kind of a cross between like Starbucks and Panera bread, but it's kind of also the worst of both in my opinion.

Everything is homemade and pretty cheap. Good variety of food options, the iced apricot tea was delicious and so was the clam chowder! And the crepes are big and made just like the street vendors in Paris. Yum!

Excellent food, excellent service, at a price you really cannot beat around here. Their savory crepes are amazing, and you can get a cup of their house coffee for a dollar. They also have great desserts.

Oh how I love this pretentious little cafe! Not that they need more business (lines crawl down the block by noon), but it wouldn't hurt for the staff to lighten up a bit and make an occasional exception on the 4 orders per person rule for regulars. Still, I keep coming back. The kale salad is exceptional. The chefs here have tamed an otherwise unappealing vegetable into a crave-worthy meal dotted with pancetta and tossed with balsamic reduction. The baguette sandwiches are perfect; they travel well and are easy to share. The hot sandwiches are delicious and large but get soggy after a while. The changing salad menu usually disappoints; they're either too small, too protein-focused, or over-dressed. The coffee is great. Everything is priced reasonably, but you get the most bang for your buck when you share a few different orders with friends. There are a few bar seats, two 2-person tables indoors, and a few outdoor seats.
Get the Kale salad, roast beef sandwich of ham & cheese baguette! Make sure you come before noon to avoid the line!
I tried salads and sandwiches, they are good, but I really wish they started serving them earlier than 11.30.
Never disappoints. One of my favorite spots in the city. I just wish you guys stayed open later
Darwin has a nice vibe and friendly service. Good sandwiches, reasonable coffee, long lines at lunchtime.

Just finished brunch (aka second breakfast) at Darwin Cafe.  What a diamond in the rough.  I've lived in Soma for 8 years and can't believe that I haven't found this place sooner.  This part of Soma is mostly dead on Sundays, I'm so happy to have found a new brunch spot.  Everything was delicious, but mad props out to the cinnamon hallah bread and the kale salad with prosciutto and poached eggs.  The staff is very friendly and attentive.  We'll be back.
Do a favor to yourself and get a proper cappuccino from Darwin.

Totally delicious and worth the wait.  They change their menu every two weeks but my absolute favorite is the roast beef. Ingredients are fresh and the chefs seem to take pride in their preparation. I've been here more times than I can count and Darwin has yet to disappoint.

Glad they have extended hours now. Ive tried many times to go but failed. Recently, i had a meeting in the area but was only able to catch a beverage there. When asked which they liked more between the iced tea and iced coffee, the latter won out. Heading to the train i got extra jacked on a solid iced coffee for the road

Since I work in SOMA, this is one of my favorite spots for lunch. This place is an absolute gem! The food here is fresh, rustic, honest, and hearty. I've gotten the mortadella sandwich and the kale salad here. The sandwiches all come with a seasonal salad. The last time I got a sandwich, it came with a salad that had persimmons and pomegranates in it. Yum! Don't let the line fool you, it goes through pretty fast. And although the space is tight, I haven't had trouble finding seating because a lot of people take it to-go. Keep your eyes open because this place is a hole-in-the-wall. As many people have mentioned, try their kale salad. It's absolutely delicious!

After searching for something new in the SOMA area, we decided to walk down during our lunch break and brave the long lines. The highlight was really the nutella and banana baguette. It was ahh-mazing! I would wait through the lines any day for that again.

I heard such great things about this place and about the Kale salad.  I am beyond disappointed. Worst $11 I've ever spent. I ordered the Kale Salad to go. It is missing the aged balsamic which I asked for on the side and asked for the prosciutto to be left off (gasp, I know).  I am literally eating a bowl of dry kale, radicchio, and Parmesan cheese.   I'm 4 bites in and on my 3rd glass of water.  If I were still in the area, I would go back and express my disappointment in a heartbeat.

Great food, true. I don't even mind the prices for the quality. But all but two of the customer-facing employees are so snarky that I'm going to curtail my visits. Over the past year our office probably spent $400/week there; we're starting to tire of the attitude and think twice, especially given you have to stand in line so long. Pre-order instead? Sure--but be ready for almost-angry insistence that you be in by 11:30 to pick up, and when you do, your food won't be ready.

This place had been on my list for a long time because I'm a sucker for a good kale salad. I made a friend meet me here and trekked it down to Soma from my office on a Monday. I got there about 11:45 and there wasn't much of a line. We ordered the kale salad and the avocado, tomato, hummus, feta sandwich. The kale salad was good but I think I'm more of a parmesan/currant kale salad person. The real winner here was the sandwich. The flavors melded together perfectly and the bread was fresh and chewy. I've been thinking about it ever since.

Not exactly sure what the big line is about. Haha survival of the hippest? But the food was good. We were able to find outside seating. I ordered the roast beef which comes with a side salad of greens, feta, and plums. I'd like to come again and try the other salads!
I really wanted to give a better review but I had a pretty bad experience here.
Darwin Cafe is worth the crazy line that forms outside everyday.
Super duper delicious and beautifully represented. The outdoor seating is lovely and inside is also hip and stylish- very SOMA San Francisco.

I was thrilled to hear that Darwin Cafe opened for brunch since I live nearby but work far away so I can never make it on weekdays.  My buddy and I came for brunch at noon on a Sunday and there was no line.
Coffee review only**

The sandwiches here are truly delicious with fresh ingredients and unique combinations. They usually have a long line during lunch hours but you can always take the food to go and eat at a nearby park. I love their coffee too, and sometimes stop by at off peak hours for a coffee break.

Yummy salads, ok sandwiches, awesome service, and LOTS of people during lunch. I tried to come in at 11 to grab my salad and skip the crowd, but turns out they weren't ready for lunch yet. : ( I went back at 11:30, John remembered I had been there before, and I got my yummy kale salad. All was good. Prices are average for lunch in SOMA.
FOOD - CHEEZ WHIZ on a sandwich?!?!  I took a risk because it sounded a little bit too much but it was amazing.  Had the Roast Beef and would go back again.
Great food quality, but the price is a little off setting. $11 for a Kale salad? It's good but really, $11?

I really enjoy getting lunch here. I work close by so it's easier for takeout, especially since there isn't much seating. a few tables outside and a few inside. the wait to order can be long, 20 minutes or more, but once ordered the food comes out pretty quickly, and it's definitely worth the wait. they change the menu occasionally, so there are always new things to try. but it's my favorite sandwich and salad place in SoMa. I often get a sandwich for lunch and a salad to save for dinner.

This place is so tasty. I love that they have a bit of everything from salads to sandwiches...anything you might be craving. Try out the baguettes that change all the time. They're generally chap, fresh, and perfect for a light lunch.
I wish I could tell you that it was ME who discovered this place.
When you're my age you've had several thousand turkey sandwiches in your life, and you don't expect anything to come along and rewrite the genre.  You weren't expecting Darwin Cafe.
Much better than the average SOMA lunch joint!

The food is good, but it definitely comes at the San Francisco portion with the San Francisco price. I got the roast beef sandwich that can be taken down in about 5-6 normal bites. Plus an arugula salad. Everything is tasty but I had to pay $12 for all of that. $12 for not even 1/2 lb of food. By that standard, Whole Foods is a bargain compared to this place. I wanted a mexican coke too while I was there but the bucket the bottles were sitting in was lukewarm. I understand they are busy and didn't have time to fill it back up so I won't ding em for that. But at the end of the day, I just feel cheated in what I get.

This place is like an episode of "Portlandia." But, unlike Portlandia, completely humorless. Someone correct me if I am wrong, but I believe it's called Darwin because in the time it takes to get a cup of coffee A NEW SPECIES WILL HAVE EVOLVED.

Kale salad is killer, wait time for a pre-made salad (or anything at all, really) is ridiculous. Even when you're the only person in the place, don't expect to wait less than 10 minutes for whatever you get, whether it be coffee, a baguette sandwich, or even a can of San Pellegrino (ok, maybe I'm exaggerating on the last one).
Shrimp avocado on butter lettuce w/herbs   Salad. Along w/Greek goddess dressing - Delicious! Cost was $12 and the portion was TINY! I was still hungry but it was good.

boyfriend and i only live a block away and we've never came here. big mistake- this is definitely a good place if you want to eat light and healthy! everything else around here is pretty heavy (garaje, brickyard, hrd, cafe chaat)

Wow first time here and already loving it. I definitely love love love the food but it's sorta expensive for sandwiches & salads (although I would still pay for it). I wouldn't know about this place unless someone who lived or worked in SoMa told me to come here, which I came here for. It's kind of a hole in a wall for those who don't normally hangout around this district.
I work around the corner from here, and come here often.
After a couple visits and some memorable eats, it's safe to say this is one of my most highly recommended sandwich lunches in the SoMa district.

this just seems like one of those perfect little cafes. well, its more than a cafe, they serve some of the best salads and sandwiches i've ever eaten. had the kale salad $11, ham & cheese baguette sandwich $5.50, and i couldn't not get the local handmade whoopie-pie cookie $3.50.

As you can tell from the other reviews the food at Darwin is awesome! It's a wonderful not-so-hidden (anymore) gem!!! What amazes me about this place though is the people who work there are awesome! Most SF cafés and restaurants with the level of demand Darwin has can skimp on service. That's not the case here. The staff is super friendly and go out of their way to make you feel at home!

I went to Darwin today because really wanted a great salad, and thought it would be a great day to splurge at Darwin!  Aside from one not so great kale salad one time, I have always really enjoyed their menu, even if it is on the $$ side.

Decent fast casual Vietnamese. Noodles and chips - what more could the mother of a toddler ask for? Of course I would rather go to a real Vietnamese pho restaurant, but you can't beat the proximity to our hotel.
Fresh. Custom. Healthy. What else can you ask for?

Wish I can give you 0 stars!  While getting my pho fix... My chicken was partially raw... Wtf??! First thing in the restaurant industry is not to serve raw meat!! Argh. Never returning again. fck that, I will go else where. Plus, they are skimpy with their rolls. It seems smaller and smaller each time I order it.  For $9... I will go to a pho restaurant instead..

We were looking for something fast and tasty near our hotel (Marriott) after a full day walking around the city.  We came here because we thought this place looked clean from outside.   Well, we were pleasantly surprised by the food.  The menu was limited with rolls and Pho...  we had both and were happy with both.

For what it is (fast food, Vietnamese-style), you can't beat the fresh flavors and cool wraps that magically appear when moistened with water at Freshroll.  We managed to get up here after the SF Giants parade, and ordered pretty much one of everything, including the pho.  Have had better soup noodles, but the meat was tender and the decent broth was perfect for a brisk Fall evening in the City.

Theoretically this spot offers food that would hit a great spot on my palate. I enjoy Vietnamese foo greatly, and the fast-casual atmosphere ensures that both my taste buds and wallet remain happy. However, the problem is in the execution. My wraps, and especially my bowl, feel like a careless mishmash of ingredients rather than an actual entree of a meal. It's hard to quantify, but I just feel awkward eating such a thing.
Very delicious! I came here super hungry one night and got the steak pho, fresh -wrapped spring rolls (2 lemon grass pork and 1 chicken - they let you mixed and match) and a limeade. Yum yum!

This place makes great Banh Mi sandwiches. I had the lemongrass pork at lunch today. I had to wait about 25 minutes in line due to the lunch rush but all in all it was worth it especially for the reasonable price they charge. They also offer complementary water that had sliced cucumbers infused which was a nice touch as it was a warm day today. There are several different sauces at the counter available to try. But I didn't even need any as my sandwich was perfect.
Chipotle meets Vietnamese food. The pho was pretty good, but I really like that you can customize your spring rolls. Nice touch!
Love the bowl! Everything is fresh, clean and healthy. The meat and garlic shrimp are well flavored, goes great with the noodles.
Great fresh food. Creative concept. In need of a quick, cheap, yummy bite. Go. Done.

This one being opposite moscone center had a huge queue durig lunchhtime.It took me a good 20 min to just get to the register.They should have process to take online order to avoid this.I had the banh mi sandwich and vietnamese coffee.The coffee had no taste.Too mild.The sandwich was ok.Tofu was uncooked and cold.Their signature sauce was good.
This place is minimalistic (streamlined for the lunch rush I assume) but friendly.  Dropped by on a lazy shopping Sunday.
Catered lunch from here and it was surprisingly good.

While attending Dreamforce on Howard and 4th, my friend and me wanted to grab a quick lunch so I took her to my favorite roll place! Healthy, clean (everything is made in front of you), efficient (you are in and out of the place in 7-8 min) and not too harsh on the wallet. My go to item is the Tofu spring rolls (3 pcs for $8.90). My friend opted for a Tofu bowl (which had rather chunky pieces of Tofu). On an earlier occasion, I had tried the Taro chips, I am not a fan but my hubby loved it, so I guess thats subjective.  But if i am in the area, rest assured, its ROLL time!
OK.  A-OK?  Kind of industrial.  I was expecting less kind of industrial.  But okay.

I was traveling on business for Oracle Open World.  This is conveniently located across from Moscone West.  My first day's box lunch was such a hassle and ordeal that I told myself I was going to treat myself to an awesome lunch the rest of the week to make up for it.  Freshrolls definitely did the trick!
Yum!  Great flavors that made a party in my mouth that I didn't want to  stop :)
Freshroll is a great place if you have a convention at Moscone center.  Directly across from Moscone West it is a good choice if you want a break from convention center/hotel food.

We ordered through TryCaviar (a delivery service) and only received one of the two phos we ordered. When we called to tell them, they said we could come pick up the missing pho (no can do with a sleeping baby) or mention this the next time we ordered so it would be reimbursed. Like we would order again. The person I spoke to couldn't do refunds (but said we could email someone) so we were just out of luck. Luckily TryCaviar refunded us the missing soup. Just sloppy.

A great alternative to the regular sauce and fat laden lunches in the city. It is just as they claim to be, fresh. Service wise they can get a little lost although it is "subway style" and should be stright forward, however they make it up with politness.

I went yesterday with my mentor and it was awesome!!! loved every bit of it, I got the bowl with chicken and shrimp and it was perfect! geesh im looking for somthing else for lunch but I think im going to just go back for lunch today,lol OHHHHHH YEAH VERY FRESH, YUP IM GOING THERE FOR LUNCH TODAY

My first time coming here I got the vietnamese sandwich with the lemongrass pork. It was ok good. Would like it if the bread were a little bit bigger. Today I came to try their vermicelli noodles. It was nice and easy to order. It was ok too but thought the vinagrette could be better -it was too sweet. There were other condiments available too which was nice. All the staff was welcoming and nice/friendly. Average food.
The restaurants around the Metreon are so unique and their concepts are way too cool. Who would have thought you can turn any cuisine into a Chipotle style one?

Freshroll is Vietnamese Fast Food. You select your meat, and you have the option of rolls, sandwich, rice bowl, or pho. I got the rolls with the pork, and taro chips. My coworkers got the sandwich and the rice bowl, and the lychee tea. He said the tea wasn't very strong, but for me the food was simply delicious. Very fresh. Next time I'll go for the rice bowl..the proportion is a deal! And I didn't get to try the vinaigrette :(( The decor is very mod with white high tables and green swivel chairs. Oh and the cashier kinda winked at me when I was getting water for my table hahaha
My Go-to place for a healthy bowl of "bun".

The best way to describe Fresh Roll is that it's like Chipotle but with Vietnamese food. You pick your protein and what it comes in (salad, sandwich, or Spring rolls), and then the toppings.  All the ingredients are pretty true to Vietnamese dishes and actually are fresh.

When moving to a new city, it's always wonderful to see some familiar faces. The other day, a close friend of mine from Las Vegas came to town and wanted to grab lunch. I quickly jumped to the opportunity to reconnect with a friend from my past. The good thing was they were moving to SF VERY soon! They also suggested this place as they've visited this joint time and time again. I was super excited to try something new!

Freshroll is like the Vietnamese version of Chipotle -- choose your own meat, filling and dipping sauce. The sauces were unique and different from traditional ones I've had at other restaurants. Great for a quick snack or light lunch. Love the concept and would definitely try it again!

Great place to get some fresh Vietnamese food in downtown SF at a very reasonable price.  My wife and I both got the bowls and we felt we got decent portions and the quality was better than we expected.
Healthy and delicious!!
Love this place! It's like a Vietnamese Chipotle. You can pick between Vietnamese spring rolls, sandwich, bowl or pho.

Interesting concept that I wish they had on the east coast. The spring rolls are often my favorite part at Vietnamese joints, so I was delighted to get three GIANT spring rolls that I chose the ingredients for. This GF gal left full and happy. Lychee tea was very refreshing. Hubby's pho was super tasty as well.
Was jonesing for pho. Came here based on Yelp ratings.

This place makes some tasty rolls. For around $10, you get 3 good-sized rolls wrapped in rice paper. You can fully customize what meats and veggies go into your rolls, so I usually get a round-robin of meats. And like I said, they're really tasty and filling. They'll fill one little container of sauce of your choosing, but feel free to grab more. I've also tried their bowls, which are exactly like the rolls except with some noodles. Portion sizes are comparable, i.e. 3 rolls is approximately equal to one bowl. One note: While their rolls and bowls are great, you may want to avoid this place if you're looking for a hot meal, as that does not appear to be their specialty. But it's a great place for a lunch!
It's like a Vietnamese chipotle for spring rolls!  Quick and easy!  I had tofu, chicken and pork spring rolls.  It was not bad

We were looking for a quick bite after the movies.  All of us enjoy Vietnamese food (one of us is Vietnamese) and we were kinda curious but didn't have high expectations.  Turns out just what you want from Vietnamese food - very fresh veggies, mix of hot and fruit, great sauces and good meat.  It was nicely done.  All of us ordered different things and really enjoyed our meals.
Great fast-food.  Ingredients are fresh and varied - get them in a rice wrap&roll, in a salad bowl, on a bed of noodles or rice.   Personnel are good-natured.

The lemongrass pork freshrolls here taste delicious! I got the 3 for $7.95 plus the taro chips. The service was a little bit slow (the line was quite long), but it was well worth the wait in my opinion. Everything tastes so fresh and makes you feel healthy.

Girlfriend and I went to this place for dinner before watching Gaurdians of the Galaxy. Her roommate recommended it and we haven't had any viet food in a while. Pretty much a Vietnamese Chipotle/subway/have-it-your-way type of deal where you can customize your orders. I had the pork spring rolls and my lady had the chicken Pho. Definitely on point and I also enjoyed their Lychee tea and Taro chips! Will come back for a 2nd round one day.
4505 Meats is decent. If you love salt, you'll LOVE this place. They literally drop the salt bomb on everything!

I'm confused why this location of 4505 has such high reviews, and I hope the NoPa one is better and contributing to this hype. I've heard good things about the meat here, but it is honestly lackluster and the burgers are put together with the thought of a $3 burger, not a $9 one.
Very disappointed by the brisket sandwich. It was mostly a $13.50 cole slaw sandwich. It really put to shame the word brisket.
4505 Meats! They have a food stand on Thursdays at the Ferry Building for the farmer's market. It's one tiny stand but they serve up a lot of meat.

Apparently they don't allow you to choose 2 of the same meats in the combo plate (comes with 3 meats) but this was not posted anywhere. I do not eat pork for religious reasons, but they refused to accommodate even though there were only 2 non-pork options...wouldn't even double up on chicken even though it was the cheapest option on the menu. They will not be receiving my business again.

Beef brisket sandwich. Most disgusting beef / sandwich I ever had in my life. All tasted like the chewy slimey greasy blubbery animal fat u throw away. Horrific. Can't believe I paid $14 for this. So nasty. Never again. Never.
That burger was amazing. No need for further review or comment.
Another hunt for the best burger in the bay since Disco Volante died (RIP).
Stopped by to try the burger - it was really good! I'll try a few other things next week.

Had the Maple Bacon Breakfast Sausage there last weekend.  It definitely did not live up to the hype. Despite all the fixings on the sandwich, it was devoid of any taste.  You would think sausage would be naturally salty, but there was no hint of salt or seasoning (it was also surprisingly rubbery).  It's a shame the taste didn't match the presentation.  Seriously, a microwaveable Jimmy Dean sandwich would've been more satisfying.  I'm giving 1 star for presentation...would've been 2 stars if not for the $9 price tag.

The beef brisket sandwich is the bomb but at $ 13+ including tax where do you draw the line ?  I would give it five stars but the price is prohibitive.  The sandwich is definitely quality but on the smaller size.  Simply the most tasty around period.

the food here looks delicious but isn't that great. my boyfriend and I got the best damn cheeseburger, the hot dog, and the garlic fries. usually, I love extra sauce on all my foods but the fries were just way too overpowering. we only ate half of it and it got worse and worse throughout the bites so we ended up throwing it away. the hot dog was full of flavor but it would be even better if they had grilled onions and bell peppers on top. the cheeseburger isn't too bad as well but it wasn't amazing. worth the try though!

I just had their pulled pork sandwich yesterday, and it was more like a pickle sandwich with slaw, pepper and some pork.  My wife ordered the same since they were completely out of the brisket, and quickly regretted it. We both complained about the amount of pepper used and had to throw them away.
Love their cheeseburgers and hamburgers. Some of the best burgers in town.

I love 4505 meats for their sandwiches and their chicharrones. I like visiting them at the Ferry Building on Saturdays.  Their sandwiches are delicious and reasonably priced but their chircharrones are where it's at. I like chiccharones but after tasting a 4505 meat one, it was like ok this is what all chicharrones should be measured against, they are so tasty.  They are little pockets of light pork goodness. I have eaten them from both large and small bags and may be partial to the small size bags becaues I like the smaller sized chicharrones but that may just be me.  Glad to see they have a store in the Mission now.
This is a tasty burger!
I've never met a BBQ I didn't like. Except today.

Outstanding BBQ. I've eaten the brisket twice and I assure you it is inspired. Today's side was baked beans -- equally inspired. Worth the wait. Worth the cost (skip dinner or eat a crappy Banquet's frozen entree).
Best Brisket! Winning ribs... the sides are too rich for me but the Farmer's Market Organic salad is so fresh, beautiful, and satisfying to have with your brisket.

The maple sausage sandwich was delicious. I shared with my son, but he loved the sausage so much, he ate most of mine too.  The cheeseburger was very good. I could taste the quality of the meat. It has a sauce that's similar to In N Out sauce but better. Would I say it's the best burger ever? Not for me, but it's definitely up there.
WOW! WOW! The first wow was for the freaking line. I waited almost an hour for this. The whole time I was thinking it better be worth it!
The chicken fried steak was GOOD, but it was the messiest thing I've eaten in awhile.  Talk about a chunk of meat that my teeth just weren't sharp enough for.  Argh.

4505 Meats seems to be known for their cheeseburger, but unfortunately they didn't have it on the day that I was at the Ferry Building Farmer's Market. I settled on the pulled pork sandwich, which was packed with very flavorful and tender pulled pork, but was an overall average sandwich. The bun itself was buttery and had a good crunch on it, providing a good balance to the fall-apart meat and the crunchy slaw inside. I liked the addition of the pickles inside to add an extra brightness to the otherwise heavy, bold-flavored sandwich. The sandwich is definitely on the expensive side, weighing in at $11 for a decent size sandwich that will probably be snack-sized for big eaters.

If you find yourself at the farmer's market Saturday afternoon and are craving a little something, something to hold you over.  Keep your eyes peeled for 4505 meats (Not for vegans).  They offer very tempting bags of chicherrons (They will be mine. Next time they will be mine). I went for the classic cheeseburger. 1/3 pound patty with a slice of cheddar, lettuce, tomato and mayo. I chose to "level up" with one farm fresh egg (over easy). With a dollop of dijon mustard and ketchup on the side, my first bite couldn't have sold me faster.  The meat was tender and juicy, the yolk from the egg slowly integrated with each and every layer of the burger. Rich, juicy, well seasoned, and beautifully cooked. This burger met my expectations. However, it's slightly overpriced, and not worth making a trip down there due to the tremendously annoying hoard of people aimlessly wandering around.

My go to Saturday morning breakfast spot...nothing bad on the menu but my favorite is the burger...eat it as they serve it (nothing else is needed).  If more than water is required, their iced tea is simple and legitimate...finally, the staff is polite and friendly...I'll be there tomorrow.  JA
Kinda sad and disappointed. I came here for lunch and was soooooo ready for their juicy cheeseburger w/ an egg but no go. Apparently, they didn't have the burger today (only Saturdays...?), only BBQ.

I've been eating their food since 2011 and I'm noticing a downward slide. The meat on the burger isn't the same even though the sauce is still good. A few months ago I had one of the worst briskets here. Maybe there are too many butcher/burger/bbq places opening up in the city and everything is becoming stale but I use to enjoy this place. Now its getting pricey for something less memorable. I hope the tide turns for them and everything goes up again. And what's up with the tax? It's a farmers market just include it in the price or something easy. No one wants random change in their pocket.

Got a brisket sandwich just before closing; not super cheap at $12, but pretty good and quick. Perfect portion size; filling but reasonable enough for me to get back on the bike and across town without regrets.
Okay, I'm just to go and say, oh my goodness. I've had a fair share of burgers before, but I couldn't imagine eating the best cheeseburger at a farmers market.

Just finished a great brisket sandwich.  It looked small-ish from a distance, but it is loaded with meat.  In fact, the ratio of bread, meat, and coleslaw is pretty much perfect.  I will definitely be back to try the other sandwiches.
One small bag of chicharrones for $3.50 is outrageous.  They taste like normal pork rinds with not enough flavoring.
Yummy fried Mac and cheese ! The hot dog is delicious ! 2 x more hot dog then bread ! The burger is next on my list
Tried the 4505 Bacon stuffed dog Zilla style, although I'm not a fan of kimchi, it was very, very good.  Would definitely have again.
Simplicity and quality. period.
Although I am blinded by my infatuation with the Porchetta Sandwich at Roli Roti
the burger: it was not nearly as awesome as i thought it would be... just average.

It is more the hypes of food stands  and the small selection on farmers market.  The food was okay but not as great as all the rating out there.  I had the Lamb hotdog, please don't get that.  The taste of lamb is pretty authentic but the price for a hotdog is too much, I will need like 3 to get satisfied.  The chicharron were pretty good, but really a small bag is to share, except if you can take that much fat in.  It is really a guilty sensation each those chicharrones almost sinful for your own health.
Best damn cheeseburger ever? Not even close.
I've been to this food stand SO many times now that I can't count. Farmers markets, Outside Lands... no matter where they stand, I'm a regular.

Showed up on a Thursday and apparently they're doing a BBQ menu. Naturally, I got cheeseburger withdrawal and could barely stammer out my order, "Ch-Ch-Ch-chicken s-s-s-andwich, please." I said, scratching myself and trying to fight the burger-delirium tremens.
One of the best restaurants in the city . Peter and his team are first rate .

Oh la la Ladies and Gents... Get pretty and dine on pretty things.  I am so lucky my husband decided to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary here.  We honeymooned in Paris so this was quite fitting for the taste and senses of a year ago...
We came here for a Team dinner and it was really good.

With so many top restaurants in SF, I haven't been to Boulevard in years.  My memories of it were:  very good food; service not bad but not stellar either.  My current review will say that the food is still very good, and our table staff service was also very good and sincerely personable.  Physical ambience lovely.
Had dinner here with my boyfriend and his family last night, and the food was exceptional!
Came here for work lunch (cellar room!) and had a great meal.

Had a celebratory work lunch here. Exceptional food and service. Intimate, old-school feel. I had the salmon and it was fantastic. Our team several desserts and they were all bomb. PS Had a bite of someone else's burger and it was divine!
i've been to Boulevard many times and they never disappoint...
I ate here on a Friday night with some girl friends and had a great time. It was filled with diners and seems like a great date night or family dinner venue.

My mother and I came here for dinner. It was highly recommended by friends who have excellent taste. We had an excellent experience. The ambiance was stylish. At the right table towards the rear of the restaurant, if you're lucky to be seated there, you will enjoy views of the bridge and the bay.  We were promptly seated on time for our 6 pm reservation.

Got this recommendation from a local SF foodie, and he was right on target. Food was delicious, service was fantastic, beverages were tasty and prices were fair. Convenient location, and not too loud even though restaurant was full.
Beautiful restaurant, and great view of the ferry building.

Husband took several business partners for dinner. Everything was very good, Problem...he ordered a very large steak (porterhouse or something) he was only able to eat a quarter of it and asked that it be boxed. Is that such a no no in this fancy restaurant? Well lo and behold when he got home he went to give our labrador a treat, unfortunately all the meat had been cut off the bone and he was sent home with just a bone. Pathetic.

Boulevard continues to be our goto place for a romantic dinner or where we take family members for a special dinner.  Their service is top notch and is unsurpassable as seen when the servers continually, without being annoying, asked us if we needed anything and even went so far as sticking something under our table leg when from afar they noticed that out table was a bit wobbly.  The food is memorable, savory, and the portions are appropriate.  The crab cakes were to die for and were the best we ever had, as they were cooked to perfection, made from quality meat (not just a bunch of claw meat or breading) and our main meals were beyond delicious.  As my husband and I work so hard we occasionally need a special night out and Boulevard continues to be the restaurant we visit for special occasions or when we feel we need to treat ourselves to the best food and service.

Came here to grab dinner with a few friends. Located in Embarcadero, it definitely fits into the neighborhood with its upscale ambiance. Food and service were both mostly solid, with only a few hiccups.

I think this restaurant just gets a lot of attention becasue of its location but it's nothing special given the myriad of exceptional restaurants in the city. I ordered their "seasonal chicken salad" for lunch and it was hands down the worst lunch salad I have ever had in a restaurant. No flavor, no thought went into it, no richness or complexity. Just a bunch of random ingredients that don't make sense together thrown on a plate.....second time eating here and I don't think I'll be back.
3 of us had dinner and each one of us raved. Great appetizers (lobster ravioli, ahi tuna tartar, artichoke salad) followed by great mains, finishing with awesome deserts.  Superb service. Yahtzee!

Though this has been on my list for years... we wound up here rather spontaneously, as their other restaurant, Prospect, was closed. We walked in without a reservation and the very friendly front of the house sent us to the bar and had us seated within 20 minutes or so.
Since its beginning Boulevard has stuck with its original concept and it works!

Overall its good, not outstanding or innovative. The steak was sub-par in quality. I was surprised it has a Michelin star. I probably should have ordered the pork chop, that looked good. The ambiance is excellent. Service impeccable.

Went here for my birthday dinner and exceptional food and service. The price tag was higher than comparable places in nyc but having tried other places in sf - it's on par with price. Notable wine list and knowledgeable servers with pairings.

I had dinner here last week with 2 other colleagues.  The restaurant has a warm ambiance and the food is good but not exceptional.  The service was professional.  I will definitely return for a business dinner, but probably won't for any special occasion or if I'm looking for an exceptional dining experience.
I was a little skeptical because just because a restaurant is popular doesn't  always means it measures up where it matters - the food.

Big disappointment... Not going back for sure! I actually didn't even finish my food it was so bad. My husband got the salmon and it was also really bad! To top it off our server was bizarre, totally inappropriate with his comments. So much hype for nothing.

Maybe I'm getting too old, or have been to too many great meals.  As lovely as this restaurant is, it did not show me anything new, and I found this disappointing.  Dined here for the first time last night, a birthday celebration.  Everything we ordered was fine, but nothing particularly impressed or dazzled us, which, for the price, we rather expected.  That's my first (limp) complaint.  My second complaint is more serious.  It reeked.  They have a very serious oven venting problem (or so said the very competent waiter when I asked, and who on his own initiative removed the cost of our desserts from the bill due to the 'atmosphere').  All of a sudden we would get an overwhelming stench of something like sterno, which would pass in 5 minutes.  Then another blast of something more carbon-like (like the smell of animal fat soaked briquets?) from the oven.  It seriously detracted from enjoyment of our meal and MANAGEMENT SHOULD SOLVE THIS PROBLEM.

The whole experience here was fantastic.  We got there super early for a 9pm res so we sat at the bar and had a couple drinks (the bees knees - whoa! and some good pinot).  We were seated near the back of the restaurant with a nice view of the lighted bay bridge.  Service was excellent the whole time - we didn't feel bothered, but never waited for anything we needed.  Now I can't remember what we had (squab, I think, and maybe lamb) and apps... whatever it was, it was delicious, all of it.  We'll definitely be back here!

Just had lunch here today while taking care some business in the Embarcadero. I was welcomed with warmth from everyone the moment I stepped into the door to being seated. Unfortunately, things went downhill from there.

We had a reservation for 6:30, arrived at 6:25 - we were seated as soon as we walking in the door. The tables for two are a little small - but the ambiance is really nice. Great food, great location. Valet was easy and quick.

Great service. 8:15 reservation. Place was packed, got seated immediately, at a table with a view of the Bay Bridge light show. Excellent service. Two salads ordered, heirloom tomato and Avocado/Hearts of Palm and Truffle... Both great. The four of us ordered quail, pork chop, lamb t-bone and sole. Every entree was full of amazing flavors, we sampled from each other! We brought one bottle of wine and purchased one bottle, so no corkage on the one we brought. Will definitely return. Highly recommend!
Came here for my birthday dinner!

We were 15 minutes late to our dinner reservation but we didn't have a problem at all, even though it was packed. Had an ahi tuna dish as an appetizer and it was delicious. Tried the berkshire pork and it equally as tasty. Portions are (arguably) small but I thought they were just right. The food is very high quality, as it should be for the price. Service was very professional. Well done, Boulevard, well done.

I gave this place 2 stars for the wine, as the food and place was average at best. We had the swordfish, and pork, but both meals were boring, unimaginative, and lacking accompaniments to make them stand out.  The place is loud, and crowded, when the waiter asked me how the meal was, and I explained the above, he advised that due to being so busy, they have to make the meals with Subtle  tastes.  Very disappointed in this place after reading the reviews on here.

I went to Boulevard with some friends and we had a wonderful time. We started off with a special pasta dish to share with white truffles, which was absolutely fabulous. I recommend not sharing it, and getting it as your starter. For main dishes I would highly recommend the Kurabuta Pork or the Filet of beef. Both were excellent dishes. We passed on the dessert and went with a cheese plate. The cheese plate is good, but not great. Nobody beats Garyo Danko for cheeses. The restaurant was packed like always, even 5 years ago during the recession. The service was pretty good, and I recommend getting the table in the back of the restaurant so you can enjoy the views of the Bay Bridge both for dinner and lunch. Overall, a great place to come enjoy a fine meal with friends or on date night. A little tweaks here and there and this place will be 5 stars on my list. Boulevard isn't going anywhere for years to come during good times and even the bad times of the economy. This place is here to stay and great location as well.
Good service, good food.

Wonderful experience at the Boulevard. My boyfriend and I were visiting San Francisco and wanted to try a place that fit our foodie needs/wants. The presentation of the food was spot on and the service complimented the experience perfectly. Our waitress was very knowledgable about the food including origin, how it was prepared and how she would suggest we remake the dishes at our own home. Very happy with the experience and my boyfriend and I look forward to visiting again with our friends.
Our go-to place in San Francisco. Love the food and decor. I miss their orange creme brulee though. Hope they bring it back soon.
Everything on the menu looked wonderful. I had the pork chop which was amazing. The best jewel of the night was the Moscow Mule. Perfection!! I have it a four for the price and wait.

Awesome French restaurant. We went there by chance and we were actually not expecting a Michelin-star! The quil was so delicately cooked. It's great in the look, the smell, and the taste~ Great service and also icecream :)

It was good, not spectacular.  We had a similar meal at Insalata's later on in the week, and it was equally as good (saying this because the items we ordered were very similar).  I really do wish I could give it more starts, but it was just A-OK as yelp says 3 stars indicates.

Wonderful destination restaurant. We decided to come here for dinner tonight despite not having a rsvp. We were able to snatch one of the tables in the bar area. Service is efficient, friendly, and knowledgeable of the wine list. Excellent food and reasonable price. We had 1 starter, 2 entrees, 2 wines for a total of $144 before tips. I do hate that they charge the SF health fee.
